1. To understand how to perform returns in your market, open the tab for your market.

2. Look for the correct Order Management System (OMS), the item's type and condition, to find which return scenario you need to follow.

3. Open the drop-down corresponding to your Market, Return type and the product's condition, and follow the instructions as outlined.

Have any questions? Please raise them with your supervisor.

For information about creating a return in Fluent Commerce, see the article 'How to: Return an order'.

For info about return reasons, review the article 'Fluent Commerce Return Reasons'.

1. How to initiate a return

There are two options for creating a return of an accessory with DHL, a) via the Returns Portal (Fluent Commerce orders only) or b) manually. The preferred method is always to use the Returns Portal as this will automate the process without need of manual actions.

Step by step guide (read carefully):

  1. Ask the customer to enter his/her data and to also add the order nr. in the reference field (this is important to track the return afterwards)

  2. If the customer has more than one parcel, ask him/her to create as many return labels as there are parcels using the link. (or do it for the customer)

  3. (If you want to take the time and do the customer a favour, you may do steps 2./3. and 4 for the customer and send the customer the finished return label)

  4. Ask the customer to print this label and to paste it on the box

  5. Some parcel shops also provide a printing service. The customer can review their parcel shop on this page, to see if it offers a printing service for the return label.

  6. Inform the customer that product(s) must be returned inside a square-shaped cardboard box or plastic bag with following maximum dimensions, otherwise it might be rejected at the drop-off point.

  7. Ask the customer to keep the return receipt until the refund is issued.

  8. The customer needs to send us a proof of return. Once we receive the proof of return, you need to manually update the status of the return to 'Complete'. Once the status is set to 'Complete', this will trigger the refund process.

If the customer did not receive the e-mail:

  1. Provide the customer this link here depending on the market (copy the link as is, do not click in before):

  • DE: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=b74d0a3d3565d92a1fd6166d3d527cb9f65231891d1a9f5557de44052f0fb709

  • AT: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=a582de6c9ab94d077939c3cde3d606b5df9be8e25dbadab526c3dbd398054947

  • BE: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=ca377a67ceb65c29b6d3ed70f01c037cac4e045c6b1551a9f33084f9ecacd986

  • NL: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=468830c161c8f22c1bcb723a69be3b5736812c7e92f9a828216e7d0eef1c954f

  • PL: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=3edff50f0871f4980c149691d7d5b6dd82e3ba0db6ded07294cc3582ba847035

  • CH: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=84ab809c4a9228587abad89ceb44008d9a071f02c3afa142a2920e0989383ea7

  • UK: TBD

  • FR: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=da08269d8316fa7775f735341a4363669c80a3deb4165e2b3ad87cc97c1a67cd

Only for DE: also offer option to present the QR-code when handing over the parcel (multiple parcels: repeat for every parcel with a different return label. DHL will only accept one-time usage of a label.)

​

Ask the customer to return the parcel thef following ways:

  1. DE: DHL parcel shop, pack station or take away from DHL delivery person (further info here: https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden/pakete-versenden/retoure.html)

    The customer also has option to book a pick-up with DHL using the following link, but has to pay the additional fee (currently 3€) him/herself in the booking portal: https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden/pakete-versenden/online-frankieren.html?type=Pickup

  2. AT: ÖPAG parcel shop, handover to the ÖPAG Postmen or drop-off in parcel locker

  3. CH: Swiss post parcel shop or drop-off in parcel locker

  4. NL: PostNL parcel shop or handover to the PostNL Postmen (max. 5 items for take away)

  5. BE: BPost parcel shop

  6. PL: Poczta Polska parcel shop

  7. UK: TBD

  8. FR: TBD

Important note: Product(s) must be returned inside a square-shaped cardboard box or plastic bag with following maximum dimensions, otherwise it might be rejected at the drop-off point.:

DE: 120x60x60cm /31.5kg (unpacked possible with certain drop-off points)

AT: 100x60x60cm / 31.5kg

CH: 120x60x60cm / 30.0kg

NL: 120x50x50cm / 30.0kg

BE: 120x60x60cm / 30.0kg

PL: 120x60x60cm / 31.5kg

UK: TBD

FR: TBD

Ask the customer to keep the return receipt until the refund is issued.

2. How the refund is triggered

For Fluent Commerce

Once the return is completed via the drop off, the status in Fluent Commerce will get updated automatically to 'Complete'. This status update will then automatically trigger the refund process.

3. When can this case be considered resolved?

Once the customer has his/her return label, and they have no further questions, you can close the ticket.

Return method: 1 men handling (MH)

Carrier: GLS

Carrier code: 'GLS_DE'

Return Portal available? No

PacelLab tracking available? No

Return instructions

TABLE OF CONTENTS

  1. How to initiate a return with GLS

    1. First: Initiate Return on Fluent Commerce

    2. Second: Automated Assignment to the Carrier

  2. Important information for setting customer expectations

  3. How to verify if the order was created correctly

  4. Status updates in the OMS

  5. How the refund is triggered

  6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'?

  7. FAQ

1. How to initiate a return with GLS

The return process is streamlined through Robotic Process Automation (RPA).

1.a) First: Initiate Return on Fluent Commerce

  • Fluent Commerce Create a return request on the OMS. To review the basics, visit Fluent Commerce return

  • Make sure the address and contact information of the customer are correctly noted in the OMS.

  • Ask the customer for preferred pick-up date. At least 2 working days in advance, and it cannot be during the weekend.

  • !IMPORTANT! for Returns in Fluent: You must set a pick-up date when creating the Return. If this field is left empty, the return will not get sent to GLS and will stay stuck.

Note: we cannot promise GLS will perform the pick up on that same date, see communication tips below.

1.b) Second: Automated Assignment to the Carrier

  • Once the return is created, it is automatically assigned to 4PL, which is our Fourth Party Logistics partner.

  • 4PL then assigns the return shipment to GLS, the carrier responsible for handling 1MH products.

2. Important information for setting customer expectations

GLS does not communicate with customers about the pick up date. While we ask for a pick up date, GLS is responsible for organizing the day and time of the pick up.

After you have created the return request in the OMS, it will automatically be transmitted to 4PL CS. 4PL CS will schedule a time for collection with the customer within 7 to 10 days.

3. How to verify if the order was created correctly

The order for a GLS return with 4PL CS is created correctly if:

  • All the customer information is correct

  • The carrier field is left empty

    (later, this field might be updated to 'GLS_DE' automatically, this is not an issue)

  • The pick up date field is NOT left empty

    There must always be a pick up date filled when you create a return with GLS.

  • The status of the return is 'Created'

If any of this is incorrect, cancel the return and create a new return.

The return must never be manually set to 'Organized'. If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return.

​

4. Status updates in the OMS

The status updates in the OMS are automatically updated.

5. How the refund is triggered

Once the return is completed via the drop off, the status in the OMs will get updated automatically to 'Complete'. This status update will then automatically trigger the refund process.

Once the refund is initiated, banks or payment service providers (PSP) will have different deadlines to have the amount available reflected in their account. More detailed timelines per PPS can be found in the article 'Refund request'.

If the customer reaches us after we already completed the refund, they should reach out directly to their bank or payment provider company to get further information and more specific deadlines.

6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'?

Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'.

7. FAQ

You can visit the FAQ here. Because the return is handled by 4PL CS, review the FAQ for returns managed by 4PL CS.

Return method: 1 or 2 men handling (MH)

Carrier: Gebrüder Weiss via 4PL

Carrier code: 'GW_AT'

Return Portal available? No

PacelLab tracking available? No

Return instructions

  1. How to initiate a return with Gebrüder Weiss

  2. Important information for setting customer expectations

  3. How to verify if the return was created correctly

  4. How are status updates handled for the return?

  5. How the refund is triggered

  6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'?

  7. Have other questions about Gebrüder Weiss returns?

1. How to initiate a return with Gebrüder Weiss

Step 1: Ensure customer details: Phone number, email, and pick-up address must be correct. So the carrier can arrange the pick up.

Step 2: Select all the items, inform the quantities, product conditions (packed/unpacked) and return reason.

If the customer has to return a big item (mattress or bed) and an accessory, create only 1 return and add all the items. This way all items get picked up by the same carrier and the customer does not need to return any product separatly.

Step 3: Pick-up date: Leave empty.

Step 4: For Fluent Commerce only: Status will be 'Created' automatically. Do not mark the return as 'Organized' manually.

2. Important information for setting customer expectations

  • Gebrüder Weiss will contact the customer to schedule a pick-up.

  • Never promise a pick-up date; it must be arranged with the carrier.

  • Gebrüder Weiss will send one or two employees with a truck for collection.

3. How to verify if the return was created correctly

In Fluent Commerce

  • The customer contact details are correct

  • The return status must be set to 'Created'

  • The return date must be left empty

    (After saving, this might be updated to 'GW_AT' or 'GW_DE' automatically by the tool, this is not an issue)

  • The carrier field is left empty

Note: Do not manually set the status to 'Organized'. If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return.

​

4. How are status updates handled for the return?

  • 4PL CS updates the status in the Order Management System (OMS) within 7-10 days.

  • For detailed updates, check 4PL's Optilo platform.

  • If no updates after 10 days, escalate via the 4PL CS Jira portal .

5. How the refund is triggered

Fluent Commerce:

Status updates to 'Complete' automatically trigger the refund.

Note: Banks or payment service providers (PSP) will have different deadlines to have the amount available reflected in their account. More detailed timelines per PSP can be found in the article 'Refund request'.

If the customer reaches us after we already completed the refund, they should reach out directly to their bank or payment provider company to get further information and more specific deadlines.

6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'?

Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'.

7. FAQ

Note: Since these returns are managed by 4PL, be sure to also check the 4PL documentation if you cannot find your answer here

More about 4PL Returns

4PL Central Station (referred to as 4PL or 4PLCS) is an intermediary party between Emma and return carriers. They organize returns for some product categories in some markets for us.

TABLE OF CONTENTS

  1. What does 4PLCS do?

  2. How to request a return from 4PLCS?

  3. How to handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return?

  4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS

  5. FAQ

    1. How can I cancel the return with 4PL?

    2. The customer asks to change the pick up date

    3. The customer asks to change the address for the pick up

    4. The carrier did not pick up all the items

    5. The carrier did not contact the customer

    6. The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date

    7. The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any

    8. How do I get the proof of return?

1. What does 4PLCS do?

This company takes over a few tasks:

  • Deciding which return carrier to use for which products

  • Arranging the return with the return carrier

  • Communicating with the carrier when something did not go as planned

  • Tracking the status of the returns

  • Notifying Emma when the product was returned so we can start the refund process

2. How to: Request a return from 4PLCS?

In Fluent Commerce, the assigned to 4PL is automatically.

In Magento, you will then need to select “4PLCS” as the return method in Magento (including the pick-up date for category 2 items) and then the return will automatically be arranged.

3. How to: Handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return?

In the 4PLCS team, there is a team of operations managers who will handle your requests regarding returns. You can reach them via the 4PL Jira Portal [link to 4PL Jira portal].

  • Return cancellation

  • Return adjustment (e.g. change pick-up address or customer contact info)

  • Pick-up re-scheduling

  • Others

You will also need to provide the order number and the return ID from the OMS (Magento or Fluent).

4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS

Returns can be tracked using 4PL CS's own system called 'Optilo'. Optilo can be accessed via this link [OPTILO / Tracking - search ]

Note: It can take 2-3 days since the return was created to show up in Optilo. Wait for 2-3 days before checking to get a more reliable insight.

Step 1: Access Optilo portal and search order

  1. Access the following web page: OPTILO / Tracking - search

  2. Depending on the ID you have select the following reference type:

  3. These IDs then be found in Fluent and Magento respectively.

  4. Complete captcha and then hit 'Search' order.

ID Emma

Reference name

Fluent Return ID: 00xx-xxxx-xxxxx-x

Magento return: “Order Number”

Sales order no. 2

[MH1]​

Step 2: Identify the status of the return

  1. Identify the order

  2. Click on 'No.' and check 'Events' sections.

  3. Real date is the actual date

  4. To understand the status of the return, use the following table.

Status

Explanation

100 - Created

Return was newly created

250 - Planned

Return is planned and waiting for carrier respose

290 - Confirmed by carrier

Carrier has confirmed reception of the return to be scheduled on their system

313 - Pickup attempt unsuccessful

The pickup was unsuccessful. The reasons might be customer was absent, goods were not ready etc

450 - On the way

Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return is on the way to the destination (warehouse or disposal)

600 - Delivered

Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return was delivered to the final destination

946 - Cancelled

The pick up failed, for some reason

950 - Cancelled

The return was cancelled

Step 3: In case you can’t find your order, or it has been cancelled

  • Check again the status of the return in Fluent OMS or Magento and verify if return was opened correctly

  • Check open Jira tickets by 4PL to Emma (Many orders are stuck in Jira waiting for a response). Search for Jira tickets on this portal that have the same order number as the one you are working on.

5. FAQ

When cancelling a return that is handled by 4PL, you must cancel the return in the OMS AND cancel the return with 4PL directly. Only when both have been completed, you have correctly cancelled the return.

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return cancellation'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Return cancellation of [put your order number]'

  4. Once you receive confirmation on the Jira ticket if the return was cancelled, the return will automatically be cancelled in the OMS too.

You must not cancel the return in Fluent Commerce, as that will be done by 4PL.

The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly.

Only if that is not possible, do the following:

For Magento

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Pick-up rescheduling'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up date for [put your order number]'

For Fluent Commerce

If changing the pick up date is impossible via the return carrier, you must:

  1. Tell the customer that the the carrier might already be on the way. You will still attempt to cancel it, but it might be that the carrier will still go to the customer (because the cancellation will not reach them in time). Ask the customer to refuse the pick up when that happens.

  2. Ask 4PL to cancel the return (see 'How can I cancel the return')

  3. Once the return is cancelled, create a new return but ensure the pick up information is correct.

The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly.

Only if that is not possible, do the following:

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return adjustment'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up address for [put your order number]'

If 4PL informs you that the return has already been scheduled and they cannot change the address, 4PL can sometimes cancel the return. If 4PL informs you that they have cancelled the return, you can create a new return with the corrected address.

  1. Verify in the OMS if a return was created for all items.

    1. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items.

    2. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 2.

  2. Verify the status of the return with the carrier.

  3. If everything was created correctly but the carrier did not show up yet, file a Jira ticket on the 4PL Jira portal.

  4. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Incorrect SKU category return'

  5. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return.

  6. Follow up on the Jira ticket.

  1. Verify in the OMS if a return was created correctly for all items.

    If you don't know for sure if it was created correctly, review the 'How to verify if the return was created correctly' paragraph on the instruction page for the specific return situation.

    Be sure to check if the correct return method was picked for the item and condition. Meaning, if a return with 4PL was created but the item is an accessory, it is not the correct method for the return item and condition.

  2. Check the status of the return. The status must be set to 'Return created' after you created the return, and must never manually be set to organized.

    TIP: You can review the Activity log on the returns page, to see who/what changed the return status. If the return was created correctly, the status updates after 'Return created' will always be done by the system (not by an agent).

    1. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items.

    2. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 3.

  3. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. You can use the instructions in the article 'Status tracking of Returns with 4PL CS'.

  4. If the return was not created correctly, please cancel the return and create a new one.

    Understand this means that the return will be created anew, and inform the customer of the expected timeline for the return.

    Don't know the timeline? Review the instruction page for the specific return situation.

  3. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

    3. Market: the market

  1. The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any

    Check the tracking information via Optilo, to ensure the packing material has not been delivered yet. It often happens that the packing material has already arrived in the meantime and that the item has been picked up.

    If this didn't happen, move to step 2.

  2. Confirm if the item condition in Fluent Commerce or Magento is set as 'unpacked'.

    If the status is set to 'packed', no packing material will be sent to the customer as the item is already packed.

  3. Check and contact the customer to get the exact item condition. If the item is (unpacked), kindly be informed that the return will be resubmitted. This means that the current return has to be canceled, and a new one will be initiated.

    Once the return is created correctly, the pickup will be assigned to a carrier within 7-10 normal days from the return creation date. The customer will receive the packaging material in the next days.

Carrier: Gebrüder Weiss

Return instructions

  1. How to initiate a return with Gebrüder Weiss

  2. Important information for setting customer expectations

  3. How to verify if the return was created correctly

  4. How are status updates handled for the return?

  5. How the refund is triggered

  6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'?

  7. Have other questions about Gebrüder Weiss returns?

1. How to initiate a return with Gebrüder Weiss

Step 1: Ensure customer details: Phone number, email, and pick-up address must be correct. So the carrier can arrange the pick up.

Step 2: Select all the items, inform the quantities, product conditions (packed/unpacked) and return reason.

If the customer has to return a big item (mattress or bed) and an accessory, create only 1 return and add all the items. This way all items get picked up by the same carrier and the customer does not need to return any product separatly.

Step 3: Pick-up date: Leave empty.

Step 4: For Fluent Commerce only: Status will be 'Created' automatically. Do not mark the return as 'Organized' manually.

2. Important information for setting customer expectations

  • Gebrüder Weiss will contact the customer to schedule a pick-up.

  • Never promise a pick-up date; it must be arranged with the carrier.

  • Gebrüder Weiss will send one or two employees with a truck for collection.

3. How to verify if the return was created correctly

In Fluent Commerce

  • The customer contact details are correct

  • The return status must be set to 'Created'

  • The return date must be left empty

    (After saving, this might be updated to 'GW_AT' or 'GW_DE' automatically by the tool, this is not an issue)

  • The carrier field is left empty

Note: Do not manually set the status to 'Organized'. If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return.

​

4. How are status updates handled for the return?

  • 4PL CS updates the status in the Order Management System (OMS) within 7-10 days.

  • For detailed updates, check 4PL's Optilo platform.

  • If no updates after 10 days, escalate via the 4PL CS Jira portal .

5. How the refund is triggered

Fluent Commerce:

Status updates to 'Complete' automatically trigger the refund.

Note: Banks or payment service providers (PSP) will have different deadlines to have the amount available reflected in their account. More detailed timelines per PSP can be found in the article 'Refund request'.

If the customer reaches us after we already completed the refund, they should reach out directly to their bank or payment provider company to get further information and more specific deadlines.

6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'?

Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'.

7. FAQ

Note: Since these returns are managed by 4PL, be sure to also check the 4PL documentation if you cannot find your answer here

1. How to initiate a return

There are two options for creating a return of an accessory with DHL, a) via the Returns Portal (Fluent Commerce orders only) or b) manually. The preferred method is always to use the Returns Portal as this will automate the process without need of manual actions.

Step by step guide (read carefully):

  1. Ask the customer to enter his/her data and to also add the order nr. in the reference field (this is important to track the return afterwards)

  2. If the customer has more than one parcel, ask him/her to create as many return labels as there are parcels using the link. (or do it for the customer)

  3. (If you want to take the time and do the customer a favour, you may do steps 2./3. and 4 for the customer and send the customer the finished return label)

  4. Ask the customer to print this label and to paste it on the box

  5. Some parcel shops also provide a printing service. The customer can review their parcel shop on this page, to see if it offers a printing service for the return label.

  6. Inform the customer that product(s) must be returned inside a square-shaped cardboard box or plastic bag with following maximum dimensions, otherwise it might be rejected at the drop-off point.

  7. Ask the customer to keep the return receipt until the refund is issued.

  8. The customer needs to send us a proof of return. Once we receive the proof of return, you need to manually update the status of the return to 'Complete'. Once the status is set to 'Complete', this will trigger the refund process.

If the customer did not receive the e-mail:

  1. Provide the customer this link here depending on the market (copy the link as is, do not click in before):

  • DE: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=b74d0a3d3565d92a1fd6166d3d527cb9f65231891d1a9f5557de44052f0fb709

  • AT: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=a582de6c9ab94d077939c3cde3d606b5df9be8e25dbadab526c3dbd398054947

  • BE: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=ca377a67ceb65c29b6d3ed70f01c037cac4e045c6b1551a9f33084f9ecacd986

  • NL: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=468830c161c8f22c1bcb723a69be3b5736812c7e92f9a828216e7d0eef1c954f

  • PL: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=3edff50f0871f4980c149691d7d5b6dd82e3ba0db6ded07294cc3582ba847035

Return instructions

    1. First: Initiate Return on Fluent Commerce

    2. Second: Automated Assignment to the Carrier

1. How to initiate a return with GLS

The return process is streamlined through Robotic Process Automation (RPA).

1.a) First: Initiate Return on Fluent Commerce

  • Fluent Commerce Create a return request on the OMS. To review the basics, visit Fluent Commerce return

  • Make sure the address and contact information of the customer are correctly noted in the OMS.

  • Ask the customer for preferred pick-up date. At least 2 working days in advance, and it cannot be during the weekend.

  • !IMPORTANT! for Returns in Fluent: You must set a pick-up date when creating the Return. If this field is left empty, the return will not get sent to GLS and will stay stuck.

Note: we cannot promise GLS will perform the pick up on that same date, see communication tips below.

1.b) Second: Automated Assignment to the Carrier

  • Once the return is created, it is automatically assigned to 4PL, which is our Fourth Party Logistics partner.

  • 4PL then assigns the return shipment to GLS, the carrier responsible for handling 1MH products.

2. Important information for setting customer expectations

GLS does not communicate with customers about the pick up date. While we ask for a pick up date, GLS is responsible for organizing the day and time of the pick up.

After you have created the return request in the OMS, it will automatically be transmitted to 4PL CS. 4PL CS will schedule a time for collection with the customer within 7 to 10 days.

3. How to verify if the order was created correctly

The order for a GLS return with 4PL CS is created correctly if:

  • All the customer information is correct

  • The carrier field is left empty

    (later, this field might be updated to 'GLS_DE' automatically, this is not an issue)

  • The pick up date field is NOT left empty

    There must always be a pick up date filled when you create a return with GLS.

  • The status of the return is 'Created'

If any of this is incorrect, cancel the return and create a new return.

The return must never be manually set to 'Organized'. If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return.

​

4. Status updates in the OMS

The status updates in the OMS are automatically updated.

5. How the refund is triggered

Once the return is completed via the drop off, the status in the OMs will get updated automatically to 'Complete'. This status update will then automatically trigger the refund process.

Once the refund is initiated, banks or payment service providers (PSP) will have different deadlines to have the amount available reflected in their account. More detailed timelines per PPS can be found in the article 'Refund request'.

If the customer reaches us after we already completed the refund, they should reach out directly to their bank or payment provider company to get further information and more specific deadlines.

6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'?

Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'.

7. FAQ

You can visit the FAQ here. Because the return is handled by 4PL CS, review the FAQ for returns managed by 4PL CS.

1. How to initiate a return

Step 1: Ensure customer's phone number, email, and pick-up address are correct.

Step 2: For 2-man-handling returns, select the 2mh pick-up/return service for all items.This ensures everything is picked up together.

Step 3: Set the carrier fields as: leave empty.

Step 4: Leave the pick-up date field empty.

Step 5: Once created, the return status will be 'Created'.

2. Important information for setting customer expectations

Dynalogic will manage all pick-up communications. Customers can expect:

  • An automated email with a link to schedule the pick-up.

  • Email and phone reminders to make the appointment.

  • A reminder on the pick-up day.

  • A final reminder 30 minutes before the pick-up.

3. How to verify if the return was created correctly

For Fluent Commerce

  • The customer contact details are correct

  • The return status must be set to 'Created'

  • The return date must be left empty

  • The carrier field is left empty

    (later, the field might be updated by the automation to 'DYNALOGIC', this is not an issue)

The return must never be manually set to 'Organized'. If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return.

How are status updates handled for the return?

  • 4PL CS will automatically update the status in the Order Management System (OMS). It may take 7-10 days to reflect in Fluent Commerce.

  • For detailed updates, check 4PL's Optilo platform (see 'the article about 4PL Returns' article below).

  • If no updates appear in Fluent Commerce after 10 days, please escalate the return status update via the 4PL CS Jira portal.

4. How the refund is triggered

  • Returns are completed automatically in Fluent Commerceonce the carrier picks up the items.

  • Refunds are initiated automatically once the return is marked as complete.

  • Banks or payment service providers (PSP) have different timelines for processing refunds. Check the 'Refund request' article for details.

  • If customers have questions after the refund is completed, they should contact their bank or PSP for more information.

5. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'?

Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'.

3. How to verify if the return was created correctly

4. How the refund is triggered

5. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'?

6. FAQ

1. How to initiate a return

Step 1: Ensure customer's phone number, email, and pick-up address are correct.

Step 2: For 2-man-handling returns, select the 2mh pick-up/return service for all items.This ensures everything is picked up together.

Step 3: Set the carrier fields as: set to '4PL CS'

Step 4: In Magento, set Packaging material to 'No'.

Step 5: Leave the pick-up date field empty.

Step 6: Once created, the return status will be 'Created'.

2. Important information for setting customer expectations

Dynalogic will manage all pick-up communications. Customers can expect:

  • An automated email with a link to schedule the pick-up.

  • Email and phone reminders to make the appointment.

  • A reminder on the pick-up day.

  • A final reminder 30 minutes before the pick-up.

3. How to verify if the return was created correctly

For Magento

  • The customer contact details are correct

  • The carrier field is populated with '4PL CS'

How are status updates handled for the return?

  • 4PL CS will automatically update the status in the Order Management System (OMS). It may take 7-10 days to reflect in Magento.

  • For detailed updates, check 4PL's Optilo platform (see 'the article about 4PL Returns' article below).

  • If no updates appear in Magento after 10 days, please escalate the return status update via the 4PL CS Jira portal.

4. How the refund is triggered

  • Returns are completed automatically in Magento once the carrier picks up the items.

  • Refunds are initiated automatically once the return is marked as complete.

  • Banks or payment service providers (PSP) have different timelines for processing refunds. Check the 'Refund request' article for details.

  • If customers have questions after the refund is completed, they should contact their bank or PSP for more information.

5. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'?

Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'.

6. FAQ

Check out the 4PL article .

Return method: 2 man handling (2MH)

Carrier: Dynalogic (via 4PL)

Return Portal available? No

PacelLab tracking available? No

1. How to initiate a return

Step 1: Ensure customer's phone number, email, and pick-up address are correct.

Step 2: For 2-man-handling returns, select the 2mh pick-up/return service for all items.This ensures everything is picked up together.

Step 3: Set the carrier fields as: leave empty.

Step 4: Leave the pick-up date field empty.

Step 5: Once created, the return status will be 'Created'.

2. Important information for setting customer expectations

Dynalogic will manage all pick-up communications. Customers can expect:

  • An automated email with a link to schedule the pick-up.

  • Email and phone reminders to make the appointment.

  • A reminder on the pick-up day.

  • A final reminder 30 minutes before the pick-up.

3. How to verify if the return was created correctly

For Fluent Commerce

  • The customer contact details are correct

  • The return status must be set to 'Created'

  • The return date must be left empty

  • The carrier field is left empty

    (later, the field might be updated by the automation to 'DYNALOGIC', this is not an issue)

The return must never be manually set to 'Organized'. If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return.

How are status updates handled for the return?

  • 4PL CS will automatically update the status in the Order Management System (OMS). It may take 7-10 days to reflect in Fluent Commerce.

  • For detailed updates, check 4PL's Optilo platform (see 'the article about 4PL Returns' article below).

  • If no updates appear in Fluent Commerce after 10 days, please escalate the return status update via the 4PL CS Jira portal.

4. How the refund is triggered

  • Returns are completed automatically in Fluent Commerceonce the carrier picks up the items.

  • Refunds are initiated automatically once the return is marked as complete.

  • Banks or payment service providers (PSP) have different timelines for processing refunds. Check the 'Refund request' article for details.

  • If customers have questions after the refund is completed, they should contact their bank or PSP for more information.

5. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'?

Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'.

6. FAQ

Check out the 4PL article .

More about 4PL Returns

4PL Central Station (referred to as 4PL or 4PLCS) is an intermediary party between Emma and return carriers. They organize returns for some product categories in some markets for us.

1. What does 4PLCS do?

This company takes over a few tasks:

  • Deciding which return carrier to use for which products

  • Arranging the return with the return carrier

  • Communicating with the carrier when something did not go as planned

  • Tracking the status of the returns

  • Notifying Emma when the product was returned so we can start the refund process

2. How to: Request a return from 4PLCS?

In Fluent Commerce, the assigned to 4PL is automatically.

In Magento, you will then need to select “4PLCS” as the return method in Magento (including the pick-up date for category 2 items) and then the return will automatically be arranged.

3. How to: Handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return?

In the 4PLCS team, there is a team of operations managers who will handle your requests regarding returns. You can reach them via the 4PL Jira Portal [link to 4PL Jira portal].

  • Return cancellation

  • Return adjustment (e.g. change pick-up address or customer contact info)

  • Pick-up re-scheduling

  • Others

You will also need to provide the order number and the return ID from the OMS (Magento or Fluent).

4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS

Returns can be tracked using 4PL CS's own system called 'Optilo'. Optilo can be accessed via this link [OPTILO / Tracking - search ]

Note: It can take 2-3 days since the return was created to show up in Optilo. Wait for 2-3 days before checking to get a more reliable insight.

Step 1: Access Optilo portal and search order

  1. Access the following web page: OPTILO / Tracking - search

  2. Depending on the ID you have select the following reference type:

  3. These IDs then be found in Fluent and Magento respectively.

  4. Complete captcha and then hit 'Search' order.

ID Emma

Reference name

Fluent Return ID: 00xx-xxxx-xxxxx-x

Magento return: “Order Number”

Sales order no. 2

[MH1]​

Step 2: Identify the status of the return

  1. Identify the order

  2. Click on 'No.' and check 'Events' sections.

  3. Real date is the actual date

  4. To understand the status of the return, use the following table.

Status

Explanation

100 - Created

Return was newly created

250 - Planned

Return is planned and waiting for carrier respose

290 - Confirmed by carrier

Carrier has confirmed reception of the return to be scheduled on their system

313 - Pickup attempt unsuccessful

The pickup was unsuccessful. The reasons might be customer was absent, goods were not ready etc

450 - On the way

Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return is on the way to the destination (warehouse or disposal)

600 - Delivered

Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return was delivered to the final destination

946 - Cancelled

The pick up failed, for some reason

950 - Cancelled

The return was cancelled

Step 3: In case you can’t find your order, or it has been cancelled

  • Check again the status of the return in Fluent OMS or Magento and verify if return was opened correctly

  • Check open Jira tickets by 4PL to Emma (Many orders are stuck in Jira waiting for a response). Search for Jira tickets on this portal that have the same order number as the one you are working on.

5. FAQ

When cancelling a return that is handled by 4PL, you must cancel the return in the OMS AND cancel the return with 4PL directly. Only when both have been completed, you have correctly cancelled the return.

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return cancellation'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Return cancellation of [put your order number]'

  4. Once you receive confirmation on the Jira ticket if the return was cancelled, the return will automatically be cancelled in the OMS too.

You must not cancel the return in Fluent Commerce, as that will be done by 4PL.

The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly.

Only if that is not possible, do the following:

For Magento

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Pick-up rescheduling'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up date for [put your order number]'

For Fluent Commerce

If changing the pick up date is impossible via the return carrier, you must:

  1. Tell the customer that the the carrier might already be on the way. You will still attempt to cancel it, but it might be that the carrier will still go to the customer (because the cancellation will not reach them in time). Ask the customer to refuse the pick up when that happens.

  2. Ask 4PL to cancel the return (see 'How can I cancel the return')

  3. Once the return is cancelled, create a new return but ensure the pick up information is correct.

The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly.

Only if that is not possible, do the following:

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return adjustment'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up address for [put your order number]'

If 4PL informs you that the return has already been scheduled and they cannot change the address, 4PL can sometimes cancel the return. If 4PL informs you that they have cancelled the return, you can create a new return with the corrected address.

  1. Verify in the OMS if a return was created for all items.

    1. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items.

    2. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 2.

  2. Verify the status of the return with the carrier.

  3. If everything was created correctly but the carrier did not show up yet, file a Jira ticket on the 4PL Jira portal.

  4. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Incorrect SKU category return'

  5. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return.

  6. Follow up on the Jira ticket.

  1. Verify in the OMS if a return was created correctly for all items.

    If you don't know for sure if it was created correctly, review the 'How to verify if the return was created correctly' paragraph on the instruction page for the specific return situation.

    Be sure to check if the correct return method was picked for the item and condition. Meaning, if a return with 4PL was created but the item is an accessory, it is not the correct method for the return item and condition.

  2. Check the status of the return. The status must be set to 'Return created' after you created the return, and must never manually be set to organized.

    TIP: You can review the Activity log on the returns page, to see who/what changed the return status. If the return was created correctly, the status updates after 'Return created' will always be done by the system (not by an agent).

    1. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items.

    2. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 3.

  3. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. You can use the instructions in the article 'Status tracking of Returns with 4PL CS'.

  4. If the return was not created correctly, please cancel the return and create a new one.

    Understand this means that the return will be created anew, and inform the customer of the expected timeline for the return.

    Don't know the timeline? Review the instruction page for the specific return situation.

  1. Review the tracking information via Optilo.

  2. If you see that there was an issue with the return and the carrier did not show up indeed, do the following:

  3. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  4. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other'

  5. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return.

  6. Follow up on the Jira ticket.

  1. The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any

    Check the tracking information via Optilo, to ensure the packing material has not been delivered yet. It often happens that the packing material has already arrived in the meantime and that the item has been picked up.

    If this didn't happen, move to step 2.

  2. Confirm if the item condition in Fluent Commerce or Magento is set as 'unpacked'.

    If the status is set to 'packed', no packing material will be sent to the customer as the item is already packed.

  3. Check and contact the customer to get the exact item condition. If the item is (unpacked), kindly be informed that the return will be resubmitted. This means that the current return has to be canceled, and a new one will be initiated.

    Once the return is created correctly, the pickup will be assigned to a carrier within 7-10 normal days from the return creation date. The customer will receive the packaging material in the next days.

Only use this option if the customer doesn't have a proof of return themselves.

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe that you need a proof of return.

  4. Follow up on the Jira ticket

Return Information

DPD is the returns carrier for accessories in France. Because we have the Return Portal, there is no need for the cusotmer to reach the customer support line. If the customer raises a ticket asking to return an accessory, please educate them to use the Return widget.

Please check the article "Self-Return Portal" to understand better the actions you have to take.

Return method: 1 or 2 men handling (MH)

Carrier: Warning

Carrier code: 'WARNING_FR'

Return Portal available? No

PacelLab tracking available? Yes [go to ParcelLab]

Return Information

​

Note: Normally, returns will be created via directly via the Return Portal

See the instructions on the page '[FR only] Extended Return Portal (incl. 1 and 2mh)'.

1. How to initiate a return with Warning

  1. In case a return was not requested via the Return Portal, you can create it directly in Fluent.

  2. Make sure that the correct phone number & e-mail address of the customer are available in the order and the pick-up address is correctly added in the return. This is used by the carrier to contact the customer to schedule an appointment.

  3. Select all the items, inform the quantities, product conditions (packed/unpacked) and return reason. 

  4. If the customer has to return a big item (mattress or bed) and an accessory, create only 1 return and add all the items. This way all items get picked up by the same carrier and the customer does not need to return any product separately – besides that Emma also saves additional costs.

  5. Fill the carrier with WARNING_FR.

  6. The pick-up date field must be left empty.

  7. Don't fill the fields parcelLabReturnId and targetStatus.

  8. Once you created the return, the status will automatically marked as 'CREATED'. Your part is done. It will be transmitted to the carrier within the next hours.

  9. Don't move it to ORGANISED! Otherwise it will not be transmitted to the carrier.

2. Important information for setting customer expectations

  • Warning will contact the customer by email or SMS.

  • The customer will have to schedule the return with Warning directly.

3. How are status updates handled for the return?

All status update for returns with Warning are automated.

4. How the refund is triggered

Once the return is completed by the carrier, the status in the OMS will get updated automatically to 'Complete'. This status update will then automatically trigger the refund process.

5. Accessing Warning's portal

Warning portal link : https://euromatic.warning.fr/colisweb/

Address : EMM_CONTAC

Password : Customer20

NB : This account has limited access and will be blocked if multiple users access it at once.

1. How to initiate a return

Returns for accessories for Magento orders in BENEDACH and France are handled by DHL.

Step by step guide (read carefully):

  1. Ask the customer to enter his/her data and to also add the order nr. in the reference field (this is important to track the return afterwards)

  2. If the customer has more than one parcel, ask him/her to create as many return labels as there are parcels using the link. (or do it for the customer)

  3. (If you want to take the time and do the customer a favour, you may do steps 2./3. and 4 for the customer and send the customer the finished return label)

  4. Ask the customer to print this label and to paste it on the box

  5. Some parcel shops also provide a printing service. The customer can review their parcel shop on this page, to see if it offers a printing service for the return label.

  6. Inform the customer that product(s) must be returned inside a square-shaped cardboard box or plastic bag with following maximum dimensions, otherwise it might be rejected at the drop-off point.

  7. Ask the customer to keep the return receipt until the refund is issued.

  8. The customer needs to send us a proof of return. Once we receive the proof of return, you need to manually update the status of the return to 'Complete'. Once the status is set to 'Complete', this will trigger the refund process.

If the customer did not receive the e-mail:

  1. Provide the customer this link here depending on the market (copy the link as is, do not click in before):

  • DE: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=b74d0a3d3565d92a1fd6166d3d527cb9f65231891d1a9f5557de44052f0fb709

  • AT: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=a582de6c9ab94d077939c3cde3d606b5df9be8e25dbadab526c3dbd398054947

  • BE: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=ca377a67ceb65c29b6d3ed70f01c037cac4e045c6b1551a9f33084f9ecacd986

  • NL: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=468830c161c8f22c1bcb723a69be3b5736812c7e92f9a828216e7d0eef1c954f

  • PL: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=3edff50f0871f4980c149691d7d5b6dd82e3ba0db6ded07294cc3582ba847035

  • CH: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=84ab809c4a9228587abad89ceb44008d9a071f02c3afa142a2920e0989383ea7

  • UK: TBD

  • FR: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=da08269d8316fa7775f735341a4363669c80a3deb4165e2b3ad87cc97c1a67cd

Only for DE: also offer option to present the QR-code when handing over the parcel (multiple parcels: repeat for every parcel with a different return label. DHL will only accept one-time usage of a label.)

Ask the customer to return the parcel thef following ways:

  1. DE: DHL parcel shop, pack station or take away from DHL delivery person (further info here: https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden/pakete-versenden/retoure.html)

    The customer also has option to book a pick-up with DHL using the following link, but has to pay the additional fee (currently 3€) him/herself in the booking portal: https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden/pakete-versenden/online-frankieren.html?type=Pickup

  2. AT: ÖPAG parcel shop, handover to the ÖPAG Postmen or drop-off in parcel locker

  3. CH: Swiss post parcel shop or drop-off in parcel locker

  4. NL: PostNL parcel shop or handover to the PostNL Postmen (max. 5 items for take away)

  5. BE: BPost parcel shop

  6. PL: Poczta Polska parcel shop

  7. UK: TBD

  8. FR: TBD

Important note: Product(s) must be returned inside a square-shaped cardboard box or plastic bag with following maximum dimensions, otherwise it might be rejected at the drop-off point.:

DE: 120x60x60cm /31.5kg (unpacked possible with certain drop-off points)

AT: 100x60x60cm / 31.5kg

CH: 120x60x60cm / 30.0kg

NL: 120x50x50cm / 30.0kg

BE: 120x60x60cm / 30.0kg

PL: 120x60x60cm / 31.5kg

UK: TBD

FR: TBD

Ask the customer to keep the return receipt until the refund is issued.

2. How the refund is triggered

For Magento

The customer needs to send us a proof of return. Once we receive the proof of return, you need to manually update the status of the return to 'Complete'. Once the status is set to 'Complete', this will trigger the refund process.

3. When can this case be considered resolved?

Once the customer has his/her return label, and they have no further questions, you can close the ticket.

4. FAQ

Couldn't find your answer in the FAQ? Please escalate to your supervisor. They will get in touch with Emma to clarify your concerns.

1. How to initiate a return

There are two options for creating a return of an accessory with DHL, a) via the Returns Portal (Fluent Commerce orders only) or b) manually. The preferred method is always to use the Returns Portal as this will automate the process without need of manual actions.

Step by step guide (read carefully):

  1. Ask the customer to enter his/her data and to also add the order nr. in the reference field (this is important to track the return afterwards)

  2. If the customer has more than one parcel, ask him/her to create as many return labels as there are parcels using the link. (or do it for the customer)

  3. (If you want to take the time and do the customer a favour, you may do steps 2./3. and 4 for the customer and send the customer the finished return label)

  4. Ask the customer to print this label and to paste it on the box

  5. Some parcel shops also provide a printing service. The customer can review their parcel shop on this page, to see if it offers a printing service for the return label.

  6. Inform the customer that product(s) must be returned inside a square-shaped cardboard box or plastic bag with following maximum dimensions, otherwise it might be rejected at the drop-off point.

  7. Ask the customer to keep the return receipt until the refund is issued.

  8. The customer needs to send us a proof of return. Once we receive the proof of return, you need to manually update the status of the return to 'Complete'. Once the status is set to 'Complete', this will trigger the refund process.

If the customer did not receive the e-mail:

  1. Provide the customer this link here depending on the market (copy the link as is, do not click in before):

  • DE: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=b74d0a3d3565d92a1fd6166d3d527cb9f65231891d1a9f5557de44052f0fb709

Return method: 1 man handling (1MH)

Carrier: GLS (via 4PL)

Carrier code: 'GLS_DE'

Return Portal available? No

PacelLab tracking available? No

Return Instructions

TABLE OF CONTENTS

  1. How to initiate a return with GLS

    1. First: Initiate Return on Fluent Commerce

    2. Second: Automated Assignment to the Carrier

  2. Important information for setting customer expectations

  3. How to verify if the order was created correctly

  4. Status updates in the OMS

  5. How the refund is triggered

  6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'?

  7. FAQ

1. How to initiate a return with GLS

The return process is streamlined through Robotic Process Automation (RPA).

1.a) First: Initiate Return on Fluent Commerce

  • Fluent Commerce Create a return request on the OMS. To review the basics, visit Fluent Commerce return

  • Make sure the address and contact information of the customer are correctly noted in the OMS.

  • Ask the customer for preferred pick-up date. At least 2 working days in advance, and it cannot be during the weekend.

  • !IMPORTANT! for Returns in Fluent: You must set a pick-up date when creating the Return. If this field is left empty, the return will not get sent to GLS and will stay stuck.

Note: we cannot promise GLS will perform the pick up on that same date, see communication tips below.

1.b) Second: Automated Assignment to the Carrier

  • Once the return is created, it is automatically assigned to 4PL, which is our Fourth Party Logistics partner.

  • 4PL then assigns the return shipment to GLS, the carrier responsible for handling 1MH products.

2. Important information for setting customer expectations

GLS does not communicate with customers about the pick up date. While we ask for a pick up date, GLS is responsible for organizing the day and time of the pick up.

After you have created the return request in the OMS, it will automatically be transmitted to 4PL CS. 4PL CS will schedule a time for collection with the customer within 7 to 10 days.

3. How to verify if the order was created correctly

The order for a GLS return with 4PL CS is created correctly if:

  • All the customer information is correct

  • The carrier field is left empty

    (later, this field might be updated to 'GLS_DE' automatically, this is not an issue)

  • The pick up date field is NOT left empty

    There must always be a pick up date filled when you create a return with GLS.

  • The status of the return is 'Created'

If any of this is incorrect, cancel the return and create a new return.

The return must never be manually set to 'Organized'. If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return.

​

4. Status updates in the OMS

The status updates in the OMS are automatically updated.

5. How the refund is triggered

Once the return is completed via the drop off, the status in the OMs will get updated automatically to 'Complete'. This status update will then automatically trigger the refund process.

Once the refund is initiated, banks or payment service providers (PSP) will have different deadlines to have the amount available reflected in their account. More detailed timelines per PPS can be found in the article 'Refund request'.

If the customer reaches us after we already completed the refund, they should reach out directly to their bank or payment provider company to get further information and more specific deadlines.

6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'?

Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'.

7. FAQ

You can visit the FAQ here. Because the return is handled by 4PL CS, review the FAQ for returns managed by 4PL CS.

Return method: 2 man handling (1MH)

Carrier: DHL 2MH (via 4PL)

Carrier code: 'DHL_2MH_DE'

Return Portal available? No

PacelLab tracking available? No

Return instructions

1. How to Initiate a Return with DHL 2MH in Germany

For Fluent Commerce:

Step 1 - Verify Customer Details: Ensure the correct phone number, email, and pick-up address are in the order.

Step 2 - Select 2MH Service: Choose the 2MH pick-up/return service for all items, including accessories and mattresses. This ensures that all products get picked up at the same time.

Step 3: Create Return:

  • Quality: Select "Packed" (A), "Unpacked" (B), or "Faulty" (C).

  • Leave carrier info, pick-up date, and ParcelLab ID fields empty.

    (Note: After submitting, the carrier info field might be filled with 'DHL_2MH_DE' automatically. This is no issue)

Step 4 - Inform Customer: Provide important information for setting customer expectations.

2. Important Information for Customers

  • Unpacked Mattresses: Customers will receive packaging material to wrap the mattress.

  • Beds: Customers must disassemble the bed themselves.

  • Scheduling: DHL will contact the customer to schedule a pick-up appointment. Do not promise a specific date.

3. Verifying the Return

Fluent Commerce

Ensure customer details are correct, return status is "Created", and return date is empty.

4. Status Updates

  • Status updates are automated and reflected in the Order Management System (OMS).

  • It may take 7-10 days for updates to appear in Fluent Commerce.

  • For detailed updates, check 4PL's platform, Optilo.

  • If you see no update after 10 working days, please reach out to 4PL's Jira Portal to request for an update.

5. Refund Process

Refunds are initiated automatically once the return is marked as complete. Banks or payment service providers have different timelines for processing refunds.

6. Resolving the Return Ticket

Mark the case as "resolved" once the return is created and verified correctly.

1. How to initiate a return

Returns for accessories for Magento orders in BENEDACH and France are handled by DHL.

Step by step guide (read carefully):

  1. Ask the customer to enter his/her data and to also add the order nr. in the reference field (this is important to track the return afterwards)

  2. If the customer has more than one parcel, ask him/her to create as many return labels as there are parcels using the link. (or do it for the customer)

  3. (If you want to take the time and do the customer a favour, you may do steps 2./3. and 4 for the customer and send the customer the finished return label)

  4. Ask the customer to print this label and to paste it on the box

  5. Some parcel shops also provide a printing service. The customer can review their parcel shop on this page, to see if it offers a printing service for the return label.

  6. Inform the customer that product(s) must be returned inside a square-shaped cardboard box or plastic bag with following maximum dimensions, otherwise it might be rejected at the drop-off point.

  7. Ask the customer to keep the return receipt until the refund is issued.

  8. The customer needs to send us a proof of return. Once we receive the proof of return, you need to manually update the status of the return to 'Complete'. Once the status is set to 'Complete', this will trigger the refund process.

If the customer did not receive the e-mail:

  1. Provide the customer this link here depending on the market (copy the link as is, do not click in before):

  • DE: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=b74d0a3d3565d92a1fd6166d3d527cb9f65231891d1a9f5557de44052f0fb709

  • AT: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=a582de6c9ab94d077939c3cde3d606b5df9be8e25dbadab526c3dbd398054947

  • BE: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=ca377a67ceb65c29b6d3ed70f01c037cac4e045c6b1551a9f33084f9ecacd986

  • NL: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=468830c161c8f22c1bcb723a69be3b5736812c7e92f9a828216e7d0eef1c954f

  • PL: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=3edff50f0871f4980c149691d7d5b6dd82e3ba0db6ded07294cc3582ba847035

  • CH: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=84ab809c4a9228587abad89ceb44008d9a071f02c3afa142a2920e0989383ea7

  • UK: TBD

  • FR: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=da08269d8316fa7775f735341a4363669c80a3deb4165e2b3ad87cc97c1a67cd

Only for DE: also offer option to present the QR-code when handing over the parcel (multiple parcels: repeat for every parcel with a different return label. DHL will only accept one-time usage of a label.)

Ask the customer to return the parcel thef following ways:

  1. DE: DHL parcel shop, pack station or take away from DHL delivery person (further info here: https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden/pakete-versenden/retoure.html)

    The customer also has option to book a pick-up with DHL using the following link, but has to pay the additional fee (currently 3€) him/herself in the booking portal: https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden/pakete-versenden/online-frankieren.html?type=Pickup

  2. AT: ÖPAG parcel shop, handover to the ÖPAG Postmen or drop-off in parcel locker

  3. CH: Swiss post parcel shop or drop-off in parcel locker

  4. NL: PostNL parcel shop or handover to the PostNL Postmen (max. 5 items for take away)

  5. BE: BPost parcel shop

  6. PL: Poczta Polska parcel shop

  7. UK: TBD

  8. FR: TBD

  • Scheduling: DHL will contact the customer to schedule a pick-up appointment. Do not promise a specific date.

Magento
