More about 4PL Retturns

4PL Central Station (referred to as 4PL or 4PLCS) is an intermediary party between Emma and return carriers. They organize returns for some product categories in some markets for us.

TABLE OF CONTENTS

  1. What does 4PLCS do?

  2. How to request a return from 4PLCS?

  3. How to handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return?

  4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS

  5. FAQ

    1. How can I cancel the return with 4PL?

    2. The customer asks to change the pick up date

    3. The customer asks to change the address for the pick up

    4. The carrier did not pick up all the items

    5. The carrier did not contact the customer

    6. The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date

    7. The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any

    8. How do I get the proof of return?

1. What does 4PLCS do?

This company takes over a few tasks:

  • Deciding which return carrier to use for which products

  • Arranging the return with the return carrier

  • Communicating with the carrier when something did not go as planned

  • Tracking the status of the returns

  • Notifying Emma when the product was returned so we can start the refund process

2. How to: Request a return from 4PLCS?

In Fluent Commerce, the assigned to 4PL is automatically.

In Magento, you will then need to select “4PLCS” as the return method in Magento (including the pick-up date for category 2 items) and then the return will automatically be arranged.

3. How to: Handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return?

In the 4PLCS team, there is a team of operations managers who will handle your requests regarding returns. You can reach them via the 4PL Jira Portal [link to 4PL Jira portal].

  • Return cancellation

  • Return adjustment (e.g. change pick-up address or customer contact info)

  • Pick-up re-scheduling

  • Others

You will also need to provide the order number and the return ID from the OMS (Magento or Fluent).

4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS

Returns can be tracked using 4PL CS's own system called 'Optilo'. Optilo can be accessed via this link [OPTILO / Tracking - search ]

Note: It can take 2-3 days since the return was created to show up in Optilo. Wait for 2-3 days before checking to get a more reliable insight.

Step 1: Access Optilo portal and search order

  1. Access the following web page: OPTILO / Tracking - search

  2. Depending on the ID you have select the following reference type:

  3. These IDs then be found in Fluent and Magento respectively.

  4. Complete captcha and then hit 'Search' order.

ID Emma

Reference name

Fluent Return ID: 00xx-xxxx-xxxxx-x

Magento return: “Order Number”

Sales order no. 2

[MH1]​

Step 2: Identify the status of the return

  1. Identify the order

  2. Click on 'No.' and check 'Events' sections.

  3. Real date is the actual date

  4. To understand the status of the return, use the following table.

Status

Explanation

100 - Created

Return was newly created

250 - Planned

Return is planned and waiting for carrier respose

290 - Confirmed by carrier

Carrier has confirmed reception of the return to be scheduled on their system

313 - Pickup attempt unsuccessful

The pickup was unsuccessful. The reasons might be customer was absent, goods were not ready etc

450 - On the way

Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return is on the way to the destination (warehouse or disposal)

600 - Delivered

Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return was delivered to the final destination

946 - Cancelled

The pick up failed, for some reason

950 - Cancelled

The return was cancelled

Step 3: In case you can’t find your order, or it has been cancelled

  • Check again the status of the return in Fluent OMS or Magento and verify if return was opened correctly

  • Check open Jira tickets by 4PL to Emma (Many orders are stuck in Jira waiting for a response). Search for Jira tickets on this portal that have the same order number as the one you are working on.

5. FAQ

When cancelling a return that is handled by 4PL, you must cancel the return in the OMS AND cancel the return with 4PL directly. Only when both have been completed, you have correctly cancelled the return.

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return cancellation'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Return cancellation of [put your order number]'

  4. Once you receive confirmation on the Jira ticket if the return was cancelled, the return will automatically be cancelled in the OMS too.

You must not cancel the return in Fluent Commerce, as that will be done by 4PL.

The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly.

Only if that is not possible, do the following:

For Magento

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Pick-up rescheduling'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up date for [put your order number]'

For Fluent Commerce

If changing the pick up date is impossible via the return carrier, you must:

  1. Tell the customer that the the carrier might already be on the way. You will still attempt to cancel it, but it might be that the carrier will still go to the customer (because the cancellation will not reach them in time). Ask the customer to refuse the pick up when that happens.

  2. Ask 4PL to cancel the return (see 'How can I cancel the return')

  3. Once the return is cancelled, create a new return but ensure the pick up information is correct.

The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly.

Only if that is not possible, do the following:

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return adjustment'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up address for [put your order number]'

If 4PL informs you that the return has already been scheduled and they cannot change the address, 4PL can sometimes cancel the return. If 4PL informs you that they have cancelled the return, you can create a new return with the corrected address.

  1. Verify in the OMS if a return was created for all items.

    1. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items.

    2. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 2.

  2. Verify the status of the return with the carrier.

  3. If everything was created correctly but the carrier did not show up yet, file a Jira ticket on the 4PL Jira portal.

  4. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Incorrect SKU category return'

  5. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return.

  6. Follow up on the Jira ticket.

  1. Verify in the OMS if a return was created correctly for all items.

    If you don't know for sure if it was created correctly, review the 'How to verify if the return was created correctly' paragraph on the instruction page for the specific return situation.

    Be sure to check if the correct return method was picked for the item and condition. Meaning, if a return with 4PL was created but the item is an accessory, it is not the correct method for the return item and condition.

  2. Check the status of the return. The status must be set to 'Return created' after you created the return, and must never manually be set to organized.

    TIP: You can review the Activity log on the returns page, to see who/what changed the return status. If the return was created correctly, the status updates after 'Return created' will always be done by the system (not by an agent).

    1. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items.

    2. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 3.

  3. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. You can use the instructions in the article 'Status tracking of Returns with 4PL CS'.

  4. If the return was not created correctly, please cancel the return and create a new one.

    Understand this means that the return will be created anew, and inform the customer of the expected timeline for the return.

    Don't know the timeline? Review the instruction page for the specific return situation.

  1. Review the tracking information via Optilo.

  2. If you see that there was an issue with the return and the carrier did not show up indeed, do the following:

  3. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  4. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other'

  5. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return.

  6. Follow up on the Jira ticket.

  1. The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any

    Check the tracking information via Optilo, to ensure the packing material has not been delivered yet. It often happens that the packing material has already arrived in the meantime and that the item has been picked up.

    If this didn't happen, move to step 2.

  2. Confirm if the item condition in Fluent Commerce or Magento is set as 'unpacked'.

    If the status is set to 'packed', no packing material will be sent to the customer as the item is already packed.

  3. Check and contact the customer to get the exact item condition. If the item is (unpacked), kindly be informed that the return will be resubmitted. This means that the current return has to be canceled, and a new one will be initiated.

    Once the return is created correctly, the pickup will be assigned to a carrier within 7-10 normal days from the return creation date. The customer will receive the packaging material in the next days.

Only use this option if the customer doesn't have a proof of return themselves.

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe that you need a proof of return.

  4. Follow up on the Jira ticket

In the 4PLCS team, there is a team of operations managers who will handle your requests regarding returns. You can reach them via the 4PL Jira Portal [link to 4PL Jira portal].

  • Return cancellation

  • Return adjustment (e.g. change pick-up address or customer contact info)

  • Pick-up re-scheduling

  • Others

You will also need to provide the order number and the return ID from the OMS (Magento or Fluent).

4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS

Returns can be tracked using 4PL CS's own system called 'Optilo'. Optilo can be accessed via this link [OPTILO / Tracking - search ]

Note: It can take 2-3 days since the return was created to show up in Optilo. Wait for 2-3 days before checking to get a more reliable insight.

Step 1: Access Optilo portal and search order

  1. Access the following web page: OPTILO / Tracking - search

  2. Depending on the ID you have select the following reference type:

  3. These IDs then be found in Fluent and Magento respectively.

  4. Complete captcha and then hit 'Search' order.

ID Emma

Reference name

Fluent Return ID: 00xx-xxxx-xxxxx-x

Magento return: “Order Number”

Sales order no. 2

[MH1]​

Step 2: Identify the status of the return

  1. Identify the order

  2. Click on 'No.' and check 'Events' sections.

  3. Real date is the actual date

  4. To understand the status of the return, use the following table.

Status

Explanation

100 - Created

Return was newly created

250 - Planned

Return is planned and waiting for carrier respose

290 - Confirmed by carrier

Carrier has confirmed reception of the return to be scheduled on their system

313 - Pickup attempt unsuccessful

The pickup was unsuccessful. The reasons might be customer was absent, goods were not ready etc

450 - On the way

Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return is on the way to the destination (warehouse or disposal)

600 - Delivered

Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return was delivered to the final destination

946 - Cancelled

The pick up failed, for some reason

950 - Cancelled

The return was cancelled

Step 3: In case you can’t find your order, or it has been cancelled

  • Check again the status of the return in Fluent OMS or Magento and verify if return was opened correctly

  • Check open Jira tickets by 4PL to Emma (Many orders are stuck in Jira waiting for a response). Search for Jira tickets on this portal that have the same order number as the one you are working on.

5. FAQ

When cancelling a return that is handled by 4PL, you must cancel the return in the OMS AND cancel the return with 4PL directly. Only when both have been completed, you have correctly cancelled the return.

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return cancellation'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Return cancellation of [put your order number]'

  4. Once you receive confirmation on the Jira ticket if the return was cancelled, the return will automatically be cancelled in the OMS too.

You must not cancel the return in Fluent Commerce, as that will be done by 4PL.

The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly.

Only if that is not possible, do the following:

For Magento

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Pick-up rescheduling'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up date for [put your order number]'

For Fluent Commerce

If changing the pick up date is impossible via the return carrier, you must:

  1. Tell the customer that the the carrier might already be on the way. You will still attempt to cancel it, but it might be that the carrier will still go to the customer (because the cancellation will not reach them in time). Ask the customer to refuse the pick up when that happens.

  2. Ask 4PL to cancel the return (see 'How can I cancel the return')

  3. Once the return is cancelled, create a new return but ensure the pick up information is correct.

The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly.

Only if that is not possible, do the following:

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return adjustment'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up address for [put your order number]'

If 4PL informs you that the return has already been scheduled and they cannot change the address, 4PL can sometimes cancel the return. If 4PL informs you that they have cancelled the return, you can create a new return with the corrected address.

  1. Verify in the OMS if a return was created for all items.

    1. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items.

    2. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 2.

  2. Verify the status of the return with the carrier.

  3. If everything was created correctly but the carrier did not show up yet, file a Jira ticket on the 4PL Jira portal.

  4. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Incorrect SKU category return'

  5. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return.

  6. Follow up on the Jira ticket.

  1. Verify in the OMS if a return was created correctly for all items.

    If you don't know for sure if it was created correctly, review the 'How to verify if the return was created correctly' paragraph on the instruction page for the specific return situation.

    Be sure to check if the correct return method was picked for the item and condition. Meaning, if a return with 4PL was created but the item is an accessory, it is not the correct method for the return item and condition.

  2. Check the status of the return. The status must be set to 'Return created' after you created the return, and must never manually be set to organized.

    TIP: You can review the Activity log on the returns page, to see who/what changed the return status. If the return was created correctly, the status updates after 'Return created' will always be done by the system (not by an agent).

    1. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items.

    2. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 3.

  3. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. You can use the instructions in the article 'Status tracking of Returns with 4PL CS'.

  4. If the return was not created correctly, please cancel the return and create a new one.

    Understand this means that the return will be created anew, and inform the customer of the expected timeline for the return.

    Don't know the timeline? Review the instruction page for the specific return situation.

  1. Review the tracking information via Optilo.

  2. If you see that there was an issue with the return and the carrier did not show up indeed, do the following:

  3. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  4. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other'

  5. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return.

  6. Follow up on the Jira ticket.

  1. The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any

    Check the tracking information via Optilo, to ensure the packing material has not been delivered yet. It often happens that the packing material has already arrived in the meantime and that the item has been picked up.

    If this didn't happen, move to step 2.

  2. Confirm if the item condition in Fluent Commerce or Magento is set as 'unpacked'.

    If the status is set to 'packed', no packing material will be sent to the customer as the item is already packed.

  3. Check and contact the customer to get the exact item condition. If the item is (unpacked), kindly be informed that the return will be resubmitted. This means that the current return has to be canceled, and a new one will be initiated.

    Once the return is created correctly, the pickup will be assigned to a carrier within 7-10 normal days from the return creation date. The customer will receive the packaging material in the next days.

Only use this option if the customer doesn't have a proof of return themselves.

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe that you need a proof of return.

  4. Follow up on the Jira ticket

Summary

More about 4PL Retturns

4PL Central Station (referred to as 4PL or 4PLCS) is an intermediary party between Emma and return carriers. They organize returns for some product categories in some markets for us.

TABLE OF CONTENTS

  1. What does 4PLCS do?

  2. How to request a return from 4PLCS?

  3. How to handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return?

  4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS

  5. FAQ

    1. How can I cancel the return with 4PL?

    2. The customer asks to change the pick up date

    3. The customer asks to change the address for the pick up

    4. The carrier did not pick up all the items

    5. The carrier did not contact the customer

    6. The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date

    7. The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any

    8. How do I get the proof of return?

1. What does 4PLCS do?

This company takes over a few tasks:

  • Deciding which return carrier to use for which products

  • Arranging the return with the return carrier

  • Communicating with the carrier when something did not go as planned

  • Tracking the status of the returns

  • Notifying Emma when the product was returned so we can start the refund process

2. How to: Request a return from 4PLCS?

In Fluent Commerce, the assigned to 4PL is automatically.

In Magento, you will then need to select “4PLCS” as the return method in Magento (including the pick-up date for category 2 items) and then the return will automatically be arranged.

3. How to: Handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return?

In the 4PLCS team, there is a team of operations managers who will handle your requests regarding returns. You can reach them via the 4PL Jira Portal [link to 4PL Jira portal].

  • Return cancellation

  • Return adjustment (e.g. change pick-up address or customer contact info)

  • Pick-up re-scheduling

  • Others

You will also need to provide the order number and the return ID from the OMS (Magento or Fluent).

  2. Confirm if the item condition in Fluent Commerce or Magento is set as 'unpacked'.

    If the status is set to 'packed', no packing material will be sent to the customer as the item is already packed.

  3. Check and contact the customer to get the exact item condition. If the item is (unpacked), kindly be informed that the return will be resubmitted. This means that the current return has to be canceled, and a new one will be initiated.

    Once the return is created correctly, the pickup will be assigned to a carrier within 7-10 normal days from the return creation date. The customer will receive the packaging material in the next days.

Only use this option if the customer doesn't have a proof of return themselves.

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe that you need a proof of return.

  4. Follow up on the Jira ticket

Summary

More about 4PL Retturns

4PL Central Station (referred to as 4PL or 4PLCS) is an intermediary party between Emma and return carriers. They organize returns for some product categories in some markets for us.

TABLE OF CONTENTS

  1. What does 4PLCS do?

  2. How to request a return from 4PLCS?

  3. How to handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return?

  4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS

  5. FAQ

    1. How can I cancel the return with 4PL?

    2. The customer asks to change the pick up date

    3. The customer asks to change the address for the pick up

    4. The carrier did not pick up all the items

    5. The carrier did not contact the customer

    6. The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date

    7. The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any

    8. How do I get the proof of return?

1. What does 4PLCS do?

This company takes over a few tasks:

  • Deciding which return carrier to use for which products

  • Arranging the return with the return carrier

  • Communicating with the carrier when something did not go as planned

  • Tracking the status of the returns

  • Notifying Emma when the product was returned so we can start the refund process

2. How to: Request a return from 4PLCS?

In Fluent Commerce, the assigned to 4PL is automatically.

In Magento, you will then need to select “4PLCS” as the return method in Magento (including the pick-up date for category 2 items) and then the return will automatically be arranged.

3. How to: Handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return?

In the 4PLCS team, there is a team of operations managers who will handle your requests regarding returns. You can reach them via the 4PL Jira Portal [link to 4PL Jira portal].

  • Return cancellation

  • Return adjustment (e.g. change pick-up address or customer contact info)

  • Pick-up re-scheduling

  • Others

You will also need to provide the order number and the return ID from the OMS (Magento or Fluent).

4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS

Returns can be tracked using 4PL CS's own system called 'Optilo'. Optilo can be accessed via this link [OPTILO / Tracking - search ]

Note: It can take 2-3 days since the return was created to show up in Optilo. Wait for 2-3 days before checking to get a more reliable insight.

Step 1: Access Optilo portal and search order

  1. Access the following web page: OPTILO / Tracking - search

  2. Depending on the ID you have select the following reference type:

  3. These IDs then be found in Fluent and Magento respectively.

  4. Complete captcha and then hit 'Search' order.

ID Emma

Reference name

Fluent Return ID: 00xx-xxxx-xxxxx-x

Magento return: “Order Number”

Sales order no. 2

[MH1]​

Step 2: Identify the status of the return

  1. Identify the order

  2. Click on 'No.' and check 'Events' sections.

  3. Real date is the actual date

  4. To understand the status of the return, use the following table.

Status

Explanation

100 - Created

Return was newly created

250 - Planned

Return is planned and waiting for carrier respose

290 - Confirmed by carrier

Carrier has confirmed reception of the return to be scheduled on their system

313 - Pickup attempt unsuccessful

The pickup was unsuccessful. The reasons might be customer was absent, goods were not ready etc

450 - On the way

Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return is on the way to the destination (warehouse or disposal)

600 - Delivered

Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return was delivered to the final destination

946 - Cancelled

The pick up failed, for some reason

950 - Cancelled

The return was cancelled

Step 3: In case you can’t find your order, or it has been cancelled

  • Check again the status of the return in Fluent OMS or Magento and verify if return was opened correctly

  • Check open Jira tickets by 4PL to Emma (Many orders are stuck in Jira waiting for a response). Search for Jira tickets on this portal that have the same order number as the one you are working on.

5. FAQ

When cancelling a return that is handled by 4PL, you must cancel the return in the OMS AND cancel the return with 4PL directly. Only when both have been completed, you have correctly cancelled the return.

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return cancellation'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Return cancellation of [put your order number]'

  4. Once you receive confirmation on the Jira ticket if the return was cancelled, the return will automatically be cancelled in the OMS too.

You must not cancel the return in Fluent Commerce, as that will be done by 4PL.

Return method: Drop-off label

Carrier: DHL 2MH

Return Portal available? No

PacelLab tracking available? No

1. How to Initiate a Return with DHL 2MH in Germany

For Magento:

Step 1 - Verify Customer Details: Ensure the correct phone number, email, and pick-up address are in the order.

Step 2 - Select 2MH Service: Choose the 2MH pick-up/return service for all items, including accessories and mattresses.

Step 3: Create Return:

  • Quality: Select "Packed" (A), "Unpacked" (B), or "Faulty" (C).

  • Pick-up/return service: Select "4PLCS".

  • Packing Material: Choose "No".

  • Leave comment, pick-up date, and ParcelLab ID fields empty.

Step 4 - Inform Customer: Provide important information for setting customer expectations.

2. Important Information for Customers

  • Unpacked Mattresses: Customers will receive packaging material to wrap the mattress.

  • Beds: Customers must disassemble the bed themselves.

  • Scheduling: DHL will contact the customer to schedule a pick-up appointment. Do not promise a specific date.

3. Verifying the Return

Magento

Ensure customer details are correct, return date is empty, and carrier field is "4PL CS".

4. Status Updates

  • Status updates are automated and reflected in the Order Management System (OMS).

  • It may take 7-10 days for updates to appear in Magento

  • For detailed updates, check 4PL's platform, Optilo.

  • If you see no update after 10 working days, please reach out to 4PL's Jira Portal to request for an update.

5. Refund Process

Refunds are initiated automatically once the return is marked as complete. Banks or payment service providers have different timelines for processing refunds.

6. Resolving the Return Ticket

Mark the case as "resolved" once the return is created and verified correctly.

7. Link to the DHL 2MH Portal in DE

https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden.html

8. FAQ

MeteorSpace is our main 1MH carrier in Ireland. If MeteorSpace cannot collect in the customer's area, they request the collection with DPD (via Depot 80).

Manually creating returns with MeteorSpace

Step 1: Check for Active Returns: Ensure there is no active return in Fluent Commerce for the same items (the customer might have already created a return via the portal).

Step 2: Create Return in OMS (Fluent):

  • Carrier field: Fluent Commerce: MeteorSpace (If they reply that DPD is going to service the area, use DPD_IE)

  • Pick up date: Leave empty

  • Return status: Do not move to 'Organized'

Step 3: Send an E-mail to MeteorSpace:

  • Email: Depot 80 <depot80@dpd.ie> and Michael.Crawford@meteorspace.com

    Need to put in CC the following people as well:

    "Sikander Mosani" - sikander.mosani@meteorspace.com

    "Muneeb Qureshi" - muneeb.qureshi@meteorspace.com

    "Aamir Ghaffar" - aamir@meteorspace.com

    "Salman Siraj" - Salman.Siraj@meteorspace.com

    ​

  • Include in the email:

    o Order number: <Paste the order number>

    o Customer name: <Paste the customer's full name>

    o Address: <Paste the customer's address>

    o Post code: <Paste the customer's post code>

    o Contact no.: <Paste the customer's phone number>

    o Email address: <Paste the customer's email address>

    o SKU: <Paste the SKU of the item that needs to be returned>

    o Number of items to be returned: <# of items per SKU>

    o Product description: <Paste the name of the item that the customer is returning>

    o Pick-up schedule*: <dd-MM-YYYY>

    •*note: You must align the pick up schedule with the customer. Please ask the customer for a date maximum 2 working days from now. For example: if the customer calls on Monday, the pick-up date must be either Tuesday or Wednesday.

Step 4: Receive confirmation from the carrier for the appointment schedule. Update the date in Fluent.

Step 5: Insert Tracking Reference: Insert the tracking reference in the OMS.

Step 6: Check Return Status: Follow-up with MeteorSpace in the same email thread to ask about the status of the collection.

How to verify if the return was created correctly

  • The customer contact details are correct

  • The return status must be set to 'Created'

  • The pick up date must be left empty (Until confirmed by the Carrier)

  • The carrier field is populated with: MeteorSpace / DPD_IE

Note: The return must never be manually set to 'Organized'. If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return.

Note: MeteorSpace (Vanex) does not have a tracking link. Please disregard the 'Open Carrier Trace' link on Parcel Lab

How are status updates handled for the return

  • Status updates for Fluent Commerce are not automated.

  • You (the agent) must monitor the return status on the email thread with the carrier on the planned pick-up date.

  • Follow up after one week to ensure the return is processed.

  • Update the return status in the Order Management System (OMS).

How is the Refund Triggered?

Note: This process applies to returns within the trial period

When to Start the Refund Process: The carrier will contact you once the items have been collected from the customer. Start the refund process once the carrier informs you that the product was picked up.

If the customer contacts you but does not have the document, please contact the carrier (Meteorspace) via email to verify if the collection has happened.

To process the refund, you must complete the Order: In the OMS (Fluent Commerce), mark the return as 'complete' to trigger the refund automatically.

Refund timeline: The refund time starts once the order is completed in OMS. Our refunds team (ARD2C) usually releases the refund within 2 working days. After that, it will depend on the customer's own payment provider how long it takes before they see the refund in their bank account.

Note:

  • No Proof of Payment: Do not request proof of payment or product pictures from customers or carriers.

  • Unresolved Tickets: For tickets open for more than 14 days, create a JIRA ticket in "Order issue" at the Customer Excellence Portal .

When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'

Once:

  • The customer reported the return was performed

    AND

  • You have updated the status of the return in the OMS to 'COMPLETE'

    AND (in case of refunds)

  • You have informed the customer of the expected timeline for the processing of the refund.

The return can be considered 'resolved' and you can close the case.

1. How to initiate a return

There are two options for creating a return of an accessory with DHL, a) via the Returns Portal (Fluent Commerce orders only) or b) manually. The preferred method is always to use the Returns Portal as this will automate the process without need of manual actions.

Step by step guide (read carefully):

  1. Ask the customer to enter his/her data and to also add the order nr. in the reference field (this is important to track the return afterwards)

  2. If the customer has more than one parcel, ask him/her to create as many return labels as there are parcels using the link. (or do it for the customer)

  3. (If you want to take the time and do the customer a favour, you may do steps 2./3. and 4 for the customer and send the customer the finished return label)

  4. Ask the customer to print this label and to paste it on the box

  5. Some parcel shops also provide a printing service. The customer can review their parcel shop on this page, to see if it offers a printing service for the return label.

  6. Inform the customer that product(s) must be returned inside a square-shaped cardboard box or plastic bag with following maximum dimensions, otherwise it might be rejected at the drop-off point.

  7. Ask the customer to keep the return receipt until the refund is issued.

  8. The customer needs to send us a proof of return. Once we receive the proof of return, you need to manually update the status of the return to 'Complete'. Once the status is set to 'Complete', this will trigger the refund process.

If the customer did not receive the e-mail:

  1. Provide the customer this link here depending on the market (copy the link as is, do not click in before):

  • DE: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=b74d0a3d3565d92a1fd6166d3d527cb9f65231891d1a9f5557de44052f0fb709

  • AT: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=a582de6c9ab94d077939c3cde3d606b5df9be8e25dbadab526c3dbd398054947

  • BE: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=ca377a67ceb65c29b6d3ed70f01c037cac4e045c6b1551a9f33084f9ecacd986

  • NL: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=468830c161c8f22c1bcb723a69be3b5736812c7e92f9a828216e7d0eef1c954f

  • PL: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=3edff50f0871f4980c149691d7d5b6dd82e3ba0db6ded07294cc3582ba847035

  • CH: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=84ab809c4a9228587abad89ceb44008d9a071f02c3afa142a2920e0989383ea7

  • UK: TBD

  • FR: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=da08269d8316fa7775f735341a4363669c80a3deb4165e2b3ad87cc97c1a67cd

Ask the customer to return the parcel thef following ways:

  1. DE: DHL parcel shop, pack station or take away from DHL delivery person (further info here: https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden/pakete-versenden/retoure.html)

    The customer also has option to book a pick-up with DHL using the following link, but has to pay the additional fee (currently 3€) him/herself in the booking portal: https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden/pakete-versenden/online-frankieren.html?type=Pickup

  2. AT: ÖPAG parcel shop, handover to the ÖPAG Postmen or drop-off in parcel locker

  3. CH: Swiss post parcel shop or drop-off in parcel locker

  4. NL: PostNL parcel shop or handover to the PostNL Postmen (max. 5 items for take away)

  5. BE: BPost parcel shop

  6. PL: Poczta Polska parcel shop

  7. UK: TBD

AT: 100x60x60cm / 31.5kg

CH: 120x60x60cm / 30.0kg

For Fluent Commerce

  5. How the refund is triggered

  7. FAQ

1. How to initiate a return with GLS

The return process is streamlined through Robotic Process Automation (RPA).

1.a) First: Initiate Return on Fluent Commerce

  • Fluent Commerce Create a return request on the OMS. To review the basics, visit Fluent Commerce return

  • Make sure the address and contact information of the customer are correctly noted in the OMS.

  • Ask the customer for preferred pick-up date. At least 2 working days in advance, and it cannot be during the weekend.

  • !IMPORTANT! for Returns in Fluent: You must set a pick-up date when creating the Return. If this field is left empty, the return will not get sent to GLS and will stay stuck.

Note: we cannot promise GLS will perform the pick up on that same date, see communication tips below.

1.b) Second: Automated Assignment to the Carrier

  • Once the return is created, it is automatically assigned to 4PL, which is our Fourth Party Logistics partner.

  • 4PL then assigns the return shipment to GLS, the carrier responsible for handling 1MH products.

2. Important information for setting customer expectations

GLS does not communicate with customers about the pick up date. While we ask for a pick up date, GLS is responsible for organizing the day and time of the pick up.

After you have created the return request in the OMS, it will automatically be transmitted to 4PL CS. 4PL CS will schedule a time for collection with the customer within 7 to 10 days.

3. How to verify if the order was created correctly

The order for a GLS return with 4PL CS is created correctly if:

  • All the customer information is correct

  • The carrier field is left empty

    (later, this field might be updated to 'GLS_DE' automatically, this is not an issue)

  • The pick up date field is NOT left empty

    There must always be a pick up date filled when you create a return with GLS.

  • The status of the return is 'Created'

If any of this is incorrect, cancel the return and create a new return.

The return must never be manually set to 'Organized'. If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return.

​

4. Status updates in the OMS

The status updates in the OMS are automatically updated.

5. How the refund is triggered

Once the return is completed via the drop off, the status in the OMs will get updated automatically to 'Complete'. This status update will then automatically trigger the refund process.

Once the refund is initiated, banks or payment service providers (PSP) will have different deadlines to have the amount available reflected in their account. More detailed timelines per PPS can be found in the article 'Refund request'.

If the customer reaches us after we already completed the refund, they should reach out directly to their bank or payment provider company to get further information and more specific deadlines.

6. When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'?

Once you have successfully created the return and have verified that it was created correctly, you can mark the case as 'resolved'.

7. FAQ

You can visit the FAQ here. Because the return is handled by 4PL CS, review the FAQ for returns managed by 4PL CS.

For Fluent Commerce

  • The return status must be set to 'Created'

  • The return date must be left empty

1. How to initiate a return

Returns for accessories for Magento orders in BENEDACH and France are handled by DHL.

Step by step guide (read carefully):

  1. Ask the customer to enter his/her data and to also add the order nr. in the reference field (this is important to track the return afterwards)

  2. If the customer has more than one parcel, ask him/her to create as many return labels as there are parcels using the link. (or do it for the customer)

  3. (If you want to take the time and do the customer a favour, you may do steps 2./3. and 4 for the customer and send the customer the finished return label)

  4. Ask the customer to print this label and to paste it on the box

  5. Some parcel shops also provide a printing service. The customer can review their parcel shop on this page, to see if it offers a printing service for the return label.

  6. Inform the customer that product(s) must be returned inside a square-shaped cardboard box or plastic bag with following maximum dimensions, otherwise it might be rejected at the drop-off point.

  7. Ask the customer to keep the return receipt until the refund is issued.

  8. The customer needs to send us a proof of return. Once we receive the proof of return, you need to manually update the status of the return to 'Complete'. Once the status is set to 'Complete', this will trigger the refund process.

If the customer did not receive the e-mail:

  1. Provide the customer this link here depending on the market (copy the link as is, do not click in before):

  • DE: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=b74d0a3d3565d92a1fd6166d3d527cb9f65231891d1a9f5557de44052f0fb709

  • AT: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=a582de6c9ab94d077939c3cde3d606b5df9be8e25dbadab526c3dbd398054947

  • BE: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=ca377a67ceb65c29b6d3ed70f01c037cac4e045c6b1551a9f33084f9ecacd986

  • NL: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=468830c161c8f22c1bcb723a69be3b5736812c7e92f9a828216e7d0eef1c954f

  • PL: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=3edff50f0871f4980c149691d7d5b6dd82e3ba0db6ded07294cc3582ba847035

  • CH: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=84ab809c4a9228587abad89ceb44008d9a071f02c3afa142a2920e0989383ea7

  • UK: TBD

  • FR: https://www.dhl.de/retoure/gw/rpcustomerweb/OrderEntry.action?hash=da08269d8316fa7775f735341a4363669c80a3deb4165e2b3ad87cc97c1a67cd

Only for DE: also offer option to present the QR-code when handing over the parcel (multiple parcels: repeat for every parcel with a different return label. DHL will only accept one-time usage of a label.)

Ask the customer to return the parcel thef following ways:

  1. DE: DHL parcel shop, pack station or take away from DHL delivery person (further info here: https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden/pakete-versenden/retoure.html)

    The customer also has option to book a pick-up with DHL using the following link, but has to pay the additional fee (currently 3€) him/herself in the booking portal: https://www.dhl.de/de/privatkunden/pakete-versenden/online-frankieren.html?type=Pickup

  2. AT: ÖPAG parcel shop, handover to the ÖPAG Postmen or drop-off in parcel locker

  3. CH: Swiss post parcel shop or drop-off in parcel locker

  4. NL: PostNL parcel shop or handover to the PostNL Postmen (max. 5 items for take away)

  5. BE: BPost parcel shop

  6. PL: Poczta Polska parcel shop

  7. UK: TBD

  8. FR: TBD

Important note: Product(s) must be returned inside a square-shaped cardboard box or plastic bag with following maximum dimensions, otherwise it might be rejected at the drop-off point.:

DE: 120x60x60cm /31.5kg (unpacked possible with certain drop-off points)

AT: 100x60x60cm / 31.5kg

CH: 120x60x60cm / 30.0kg

NL: 120x50x50cm / 30.0kg

BE: 120x60x60cm / 30.0kg

PL: 120x60x60cm / 31.5kg

UK: TBD

Ask the customer to keep the return receipt until the refund is issued.

More about 4PL Returns

4PL Central Station (referred to as 4PL or 4PLCS) is an intermediary party between Emma and return carriers. They organize returns for some product categories in some markets for us.

TABLE OF CONTENTS

  1. What does 4PLCS do?

  2. How to request a return from 4PLCS?

  3. How to handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return?

  4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS

  5. FAQ

    1. How can I cancel the return with 4PL?

    2. The customer asks to change the pick up date

    3. The customer asks to change the address for the pick up

    4. The carrier did not pick up all the items

    5. The carrier did not contact the customer

    6. The carrier never showed up on the promised pick up date

    7. The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any

    8. How do I get the proof of return?

1. What does 4PLCS do?

This company takes over a few tasks:

  • Deciding which return carrier to use for which products

  • Arranging the return with the return carrier

  • Communicating with the carrier when something did not go as planned

  • Tracking the status of the returns

  • Notifying Emma when the product was returned so we can start the refund process

2. How to: Request a return from 4PLCS?

In Fluent Commerce, the assigned to 4PL is automatically.

In Magento, you will then need to select “4PLCS” as the return method in Magento (including the pick-up date for category 2 items) and then the return will automatically be arranged.

3. How to: Handle customer requests, when 4PLCS manages the return?

In the 4PLCS team, there is a team of operations managers who will handle your requests regarding returns. You can reach them via the 4PL Jira Portal [link to 4PL Jira portal].

  • Return cancellation

  • Return adjustment (e.g. change pick-up address or customer contact info)

  • Pick-up re-scheduling

  • Others

You will also need to provide the order number and the return ID from the OMS (Magento or Fluent).

4. How to: Status tracking with 4PL CS

Returns can be tracked using 4PL CS's own system called 'Optilo'. Optilo can be accessed via this link [OPTILO / Tracking - search ]

Note: It can take 2-3 days since the return was created to show up in Optilo. Wait for 2-3 days before checking to get a more reliable insight.

Step 1: Access Optilo portal and search order

  1. Access the following web page: OPTILO / Tracking - search

  2. Depending on the ID you have select the following reference type:

  3. These IDs then be found in Fluent and Magento respectively.

  4. Complete captcha and then hit 'Search' order.

ID Emma

Reference name

Fluent Return ID: 00xx-xxxx-xxxxx-x

Magento return: “Order Number”

Sales order no. 2

[MH1]​

Step 2: Identify the status of the return

  1. Identify the order

  2. Click on 'No.' and check 'Events' sections.

  3. Real date is the actual date

  4. To understand the status of the return, use the following table.

Status

Explanation

100 - Created

Return was newly created

250 - Planned

Return is planned and waiting for carrier respose

290 - Confirmed by carrier

Carrier has confirmed reception of the return to be scheduled on their system

313 - Pickup attempt unsuccessful

The pickup was unsuccessful. The reasons might be customer was absent, goods were not ready etc

450 - On the way

Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return is on the way to the destination (warehouse or disposal)

600 - Delivered

Carier picked up the return from the customer and the return was delivered to the final destination

946 - Cancelled

The pick up failed, for some reason

950 - Cancelled

The return was cancelled

Step 3: In case you can’t find your order, or it has been cancelled

  • Check again the status of the return in Fluent OMS or Magento and verify if return was opened correctly

  • Check open Jira tickets by 4PL to Emma (Many orders are stuck in Jira waiting for a response). Search for Jira tickets on this portal that have the same order number as the one you are working on.

5. FAQ

When cancelling a return that is handled by 4PL, you must cancel the return in the OMS AND cancel the return with 4PL directly. Only when both have been completed, you have correctly cancelled the return.

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return cancellation'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Return cancellation of [put your order number]'

  4. Once you receive confirmation on the Jira ticket if the return was cancelled, the return will automatically be cancelled in the OMS too.

You must not cancel the return in Fluent Commerce, as that will be done by 4PL.

The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly.

Only if that is not possible, do the following:

For Magento

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Pick-up rescheduling'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up date for [put your order number]'

For Fluent Commerce

If changing the pick up date is impossible via the return carrier, you must:

  1. Tell the customer that the the carrier might already be on the way. You will still attempt to cancel it, but it might be that the carrier will still go to the customer (because the cancellation will not reach them in time). Ask the customer to refuse the pick up when that happens.

  2. Ask 4PL to cancel the return (see 'How can I cancel the return')

  3. Once the return is cancelled, create a new return but ensure the pick up information is correct.

The first action must always be to ask the customer to contact the return carrier directly.

Only if that is not possible, do the following:

  1. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  2. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Return adjustment'

  3. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): 'Change pick up address for [put your order number]'

If 4PL informs you that the return has already been scheduled and they cannot change the address, 4PL can sometimes cancel the return. If 4PL informs you that they have cancelled the return, you can create a new return with the corrected address.

  1. Verify in the OMS if a return was created for all items.

    1. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items.

    2. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 2.

  2. Verify the status of the return with the carrier.

  3. If everything was created correctly but the carrier did not show up yet, file a Jira ticket on the 4PL Jira portal.

  4. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Incorrect SKU category return'

  5. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return.

  6. Follow up on the Jira ticket.

  1. Verify in the OMS if a return was created correctly for all items.

    If you don't know for sure if it was created correctly, review the 'How to verify if the return was created correctly' paragraph on the instruction page for the specific return situation.

    Be sure to check if the correct return method was picked for the item and condition. Meaning, if a return with 4PL was created but the item is an accessory, it is not the correct method for the return item and condition.

  2. Check the status of the return. The status must be set to 'Return created' after you created the return, and must never manually be set to organized.

    TIP: You can review the Activity log on the returns page, to see who/what changed the return status. If the return was created correctly, the status updates after 'Return created' will always be done by the system (not by an agent).

    1. If there was no return created for all items, create a return for the additional items.

    2. If a return was created for the additional items, proceed with step 3.

  3. Verify the status of the return with the carrier. You can use the instructions in the article 'Status tracking of Returns with 4PL CS'.

  4. If the return was not created correctly, please cancel the return and create a new one.

    Understand this means that the return will be created anew, and inform the customer of the expected timeline for the return.

    Don't know the timeline? Review the instruction page for the specific return situation.

  1. Review the tracking information via Optilo.

  2. If you see that there was an issue with the return and the carrier did not show up indeed, do the following:

  3. Go to the 4PL Jira portal and raise a 'Request to 4PL'.

  4. As the 'Request to 4PL' select 'Other'

  5. Ensure all other fields have been filled

    1. Emma Order Number: the order number

    2. Return ID: the return order number

    3. Market: the market

    4. Raise a request for the 4PL Central station to action or clarify (Add Emma Order Number in this field): Clearly describe the issue with the return.

  6. Follow up on the Jira ticket.

  1. The customer needs packing material, but they didn't receive any

    Check the tracking information via Optilo, to ensure the packing material has not been delivered yet. It often happens that the packing material has already arrived in the meantime and that the item has been picked up.

    If this didn't happen, move to step 2.

  2. Confirm if the item condition in Fluent Commerce or Magento is set as 'unpacked'.

    If the status is set to 'packed', no packing material will be sent to the customer as the item is already packed.

  3. Check and contact the customer to get the exact item condition. If the item is (unpacked), kindly be informed that the return will be resubmitted. This means that the current return has to be canceled, and a new one will be initiated.

    Once the return is created correctly, the pickup will be assigned to a carrier within 7-10 normal days from the return creation date. The customer will receive the packaging material in the next days.

Manually creating returns with GLS

Step 1: Check for Active Returns: Ensure there is no active return in Fluent Commerce for the same items (the customer might have already created a return via the portal).

Step 2: Create Return in OMS (Fluent):

  • Carrier field: Fluent Commerce: GLS_ESPT

  • Return status: Do not move to 'Organized'

  • Email: es.sm.mad.emma@dbschenker.com

Step 4: Forward Label to Customer: Receive the label from DB Schenker and forward it to the customer.

Step 5: Insert Tracking Reference: Insert the tracking reference in the OMS.

Step 6: Check Return Status:Check the return status on the planned pickup date or after one week on the GLS tracking page.

How to verify if the return was created correctly

  • The customer contact details are correct

  • The return status must be set to 'Created'

  • The pick up date must be left empty

  • The carrier field is populated with: GLS_ESPT

Note: The return must never be manually set to 'Organized'. If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return.

How are status updates handled for the return

  • Status updates for Fluent Commerce are not automated.

  • You (the agent) must monitor the return status on the GLS tracking page on the planned pickup date.

  • Follow up after one week to ensure the return is processed.

  • Update the return status in the Order Management System (OMS).

How is the Refund Triggered?

Note: This process applies to returns within the trial period.

When to Start the Refund Process: Start the refund process once the customer informs you that the product was picked up. Obtain the pickup confirmation document from the carrier. The customer must have this.

If the customer does not have the document, you can do the following to confirm the pick up:

  • Check the child ticket for updates or tracking code.

To process the refund, you must complete the Order: In the OMS (Fluent Commerce), mark the return as 'complete' to trigger the refund automatically.

Note:

  • No Proof of Payment: Do not request proof of payment or product pictures from customers or carriers.

  • Unresolved Tickets: For tickets open for more than 14 days, create a JIRA ticket in "Order issue" at the Customer Excellence Portal .

Refund Timelines (ES):

The refund time starts when the refunds team approves it (up to a week after return completion).

Payment Provider Timelines:

  • PayPal: 1-4 working days

  • Amazon Pay: 2-7 working days

  • Bank Transfer: 2-9 working days

  • Aplázame: 2-9 working days

  • Credit/Debit Card: Up to 4 weeks

Follow-Up: If the refund exceeds these timelines by more than 5 days, file a 'Refund follow-up' Jira ticket with the AR D2C team via their Jira portal.

When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'

Once:

  1. The customer reported the return was performed

    AND

  2. You have updated the status of the return in the OMS to 'COMPLETE'

    AND (in case of refunds)

  3. You have informed the customer of the expected timeline for the processing of the refund.

The return can be considered 'resolved' and you can close the case.

Return method: 1 Man Handling (1MH)

Carrier code: 'GLS_ESPT'

Return Portal available? No

PacelLab tracking available? No

Return Information

Returns for packed mattresses in Spain and Portugal are handled by GLS. As opposed to accessories, which are managed via the Return Portal, returns for packed mattresses need to be created manually on the GLS Portal.

Note: GLS does not automatically update the status of the return in our Order Management system. This means that you (the agent) must check the status on the GLS portal to see if the item has been picked up. After it has been picked up, you need to manually complete the return in the OMS, in order to start the refund process.

Create the Return

Step by step guide:

  1. Create the Return in Fluent Commerce

    1. Carrier code: GLS_ESPT

    2. Pick-up date is mandatory: Ask the customer for a pick up date, 1-2 days from now.

      It cannot be a Saturday, Sunday or holiday.

      Please note, we cannot guarantee that GLS will arrive exactly that day, as GLS themselves will schedule the pick up.

      Next, you must also create the return on the GLS Portal.

  2. Create the Return on the GLS Portal

  1. Open the GLS Portal

  2. Go to 'Inicio' >> 'Solicitud de Recogida'

Under the header-section:

  1. By default, the next labor day is selected. This may be modified based on what you agreed with the customer. GLS will not do any pick ups on Saturdays, Sundays or holidays.

  2. Time: minimum margin of 4 hours, between 8:00 and 19:00.

    Schedule with costumer a date and time lime, place 9:00 19:00 if you do notspecify a time.

Under the Pick Up Data ('Datos de Recogida'):

  1. Important to add mobile or email, so that GLS can contact the customer

  2. GLS sends an SMS or EMAIL, they do not call before picking up.

    Note: Do not pick up if the item is not packed.(this is an agreement with GLS to avoid picking up open products) if you like you can put other observations.

  3. Under 'Contenido': be quite simple to describe what is going to be picked up, avoid references such as EMAOR090190AAB, etc.

  4. Under 'Bultos': specify total number of packages to be picked

Under the Delivery Details ('Datos de Entrega'):

  • Name: DB Schenker.

  • Address: Avenida cristobal colon 238

  • Phone: 917715011

  • Email: es.sm.mad.emma@dbschenker.com

  • Postal code: 28069

  • City: CpVirtual.GLS.MADRID

  • Ref.Cliente: fulfilment reference or return code.

Once you submit the return in GLS, it will be created and acted on by GLS, good job!

How are Status Updates handled for GLS 1MH returns in Spain and Portugal?

  • Status updates for Fluent Commerce are not automated.

  • You (the agent) must monitor the return status on the GLS tracking page on the planned pickup date.

  • Follow up after one week to ensure the return is processed.

  • Update the return status in the Order Management System (OMS).

GLS does not automatically update the status of the return in our Order Management system. This means that you (the agent) must check the status on the GLS portal to see if the item has been picked up. After it has been picked up, you need to manually complete the return in the OMS, in order to start the refund process.

Important information about setting customer expectations

  • GLS sends an SMS or EMAIL, they do not call before picking up.

  • GLS makes 2 pick up attempts. If the customer is not at home at least 1 of the attempts, the return will be cancelled.

What to do when there is an incident with the return

  • Pickups do not change from “GRABADO” (Eng. 'Recorded') status when they have an incident, always confirm with GLS before recording again and contact the customer to come up with a solution.

  • Material a bierto , not picked up

  • No mercancia: arrive to pick up and are told there is nothing to pick up or do not know what is to be picked up

  • Absent, a second pick up is reattempted.

  • No realizada, the pickup must be re-recorded.

  • Select short datelines to have more accuracy. 1-2 days

How to track the return on the GLS status page

To know the orders that are in each of the statuses, click on the magnifying glass on the left of the page. The orders corresponding to that status will appear on the back of the page, with the name of the customer and the city where it is being picked up. The 'X' is the possibility to cancel the pickup.

Most frequent statuses:

  • Solicitada: the collection has been recorded

  • Recibida: GLS has received the order in their system

  • Asignada: an office has been assigned to perform the collection

  • Recepcionada en agencia, when the request is made to deliver in agency instead of searching at home and has already been received

  • Realizada con éxito: pickup completed pickup completed

  • Realizada con incidencia: you went to pickup and did not pickup. Ask GLS what happened to take the corresponding actionhappened to take the corresponding action.

  • No realizada: the collection was not carried out.

  • The collection status changes from 'Grabado' only when it has been successfully only when it has been successfully completed. Otherwise contact GLs to find out what happened and take corrective completed.

In the tracking and incidents section you can find what has happened or what has been the incidence, if there is no information contact GLS and DBS so we can help.

Return method: 2MH

Carrier: Rhenus

Carrier code: RHENUS_ESPT

Return Portal available? No

PacelLab tracking available?Yes [go to ParcelLab]

Return Instructions

Note: Normally, returns will be created via directly via the Return Portal

See the instructions on the page 'Returns: Return Portal: How to Handle Cases from the Return Portal'. - Version 3: Agent Instructions

  1. Create the Return in Fluent Commerce

  2. In the Carrier field during the Return creation, add: XPO

  3. The Pick-up date must be left empty

  4. Inform the customer that XPO will contact them to schedule the date for the pick up.

  5. All returns that contain "XPO" in the Fluent carrier field and whose return status is "return created" will be automatically transmitted to XPO --> so there is no need to add these returns to the contact form.

  6. As soon as we receive the tracking number from XPO, the return is updated to "return organized" automatically and the tracking number is added to the return order.

Completion of the return in Fluent Commerce: As soon as the return is complete, the status of the return will be automatically updated to complete.

How to verify if the return was created correctly?

  • The customer contact details are correct

  • The return status must be set to 'Created'

  • The pick up date must be left empty

  • The carrier field is populated with: XPO

Note: The return must never be manually set to 'Organized'. If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return.

How are status updates handled for the return

  • Status updates for Fluent Commerce are not automated.

  • You (the agent) must monitor the return status on the XPO tracking page on the planned pickup date.

  • Follow up after one week to ensure the return is processed.

  • Update the return status in the Order Management System (OMS).

How is the Refund Triggered?

Note: This process applies to returns within the trial period.

When to Start the Refund Process: Start the refund process once the customer informs you that the product was picked up. Obtain the pickup confirmation document from the carrier. The customer must have this.

To process the refund, you must complete the Order: In the OMS (Fluent Commerce), mark the return as 'complete' to trigger the refund automatically.

Note:

  • No Proof of Payment: Do not request proof of payment or product pictures from customers or carriers.

  • Unresolved Tickets: For tickets open for more than 14 days, create a JIRA ticket in "Order issue" at the Customer Excellence Portal .

Refund Timelines (ES):

The refund time starts when the refunds team approves it (up to a week after return completion).

Payment Provider Timelines:

  • PayPal: 1-4 working days

  • Amazon Pay: 2-7 working days

  • Bank Transfer: 2-9 working days

  • Aplázame: 2-9 working days

  • Credit/Debit Card: Up to 4 weeks

Follow-Up: If the refund exceeds these timelines by more than 5 days, file a 'Refund follow-up' Jira ticket with the AR D2C team via their Jira portal.

How to follow up with XPO for an update

For XPO, use their service request portal:

  1. Open the return

  2. Click the icon for service request

  3. Fill-out the needed information, then click “REVIEW REQUEST”

If the customer contacts informing they have not been contacted by XPO within the expected timeframe:

  1. Create new outbound case in Sprinklr

  2. XPO email contact: CustomerService.LastMile@xpo.com

  3. The case should be titled "Emma XPO - Pick up - [Order Number]"

  4. Template to use is the following:

    Buenos días,

     

    Necesito regocida de este cliente,

     

    Nombre : [Customer Name]

    Tel : [Customer phone number]

    Calle : [Customer full address]

     

    Order : [Order number]

    Ref : [Order Reference number]

    Sku : [SKU of the product to return]

     

    Gracias,

  5. Leave case notes on both the original customer case and the XPO pick-up request case with both case numbers identified

  6. Inform customer that Carrier was directly reached by us and once the collection has been completed customer needs to reach us with the proof of pick-up in order for us to expedite the refund.

When can this return ticket be considered 'Resolved'

Once:

  1. The customer reported the return was performed

    AND

  2. You have updated the status of the return in the OMS to 'COMPLETE'

    AND (in case of refunds)

  3. You have informed the customer of the expected timeline for the processing of the refund.

The return can be considered 'resolved' and you can close the case.

1. Click "Orders"- "Every order"

STEPS OF THE ORDER

All the orders will follow the next steps:

1. Recogido- the order has been already picked from the warehouse.

2. En tránsito- the order has been already picked from the warehouse and it is being transported.

3. En Depot- The order is already in the final delegation of the transporter, which is the closest one from which the customer lives.

4. En Reparto- the transporter is already prepared to delivered the order, which will most probably be delivered in the next 24-48 hours.

5. Entregado- delivered already to the customer. You will be able to download the POD that will serve as a justification of delivery with the customer in case of any issues.

​

You can also check the estimated delivery time as you can see in the image. FYI that it is not 100% accurate. Also, every customer with XPO will be able to select the delivery date and time via a link that XPO will send to their Whatsapp. 

 

*What about pick ups of returns or damaged products with XPO?

Once they are already recorded, they will appear like pending and the order number will include a "-D" as you can see in the image below:

​

How to understand which one is the carrier?

Orders with Base Tapizada or Canapé will be handled by XPO as it requires "2 man handling", while 1-man handling products and accessories will be managed by GLS.

Return Information

Note: For all Magento, GLS returns must be created manually. See instructions at the bottom of this page.

For Magento orders, you mustprovide the customer with the GLS label so he can drop the accessory off at a parcel pick-up.

1) This label can be found in the parcel lab, by searching for the parcel in the tracking menu, with the option “returns only”.

2) Click on return information and a new window will open where you can see the label in the notifications section.

Manually creating returns with GLS

Step 1: Check for Active Returns: Ensure there is no active return in Magento for the same items (the customer might have already created a return via the portal).

Step 2: Create Return in OMS (Magento):

  • Carrier field: Magento: GLS

  • Pick up date: Leave empty

  • Return status: Do not move to 'Organized'

Step 3: Create Child Ticket to DB Schenker:

  • Use the template 'Recogida de productos con asociados'

  • Email: es.sm.mad.emma@dbschenker.com

Step 4: Forward Label to Customer: Receive the label from DB Schenker and forward it to the customer.

Step 5: Insert Tracking Reference: Insert the tracking reference in the OMS.

Step 6: Check Return Status:Check the return status on the planned pickup date or after one week on the GLS tracking page.

How to verify if the return was created correctly

  • The customer contact details are correct

  • The return status must be set to 'Created'

  • The pick up date must be left empty

  • The carrier field is populated with

    • Magento: GLS

Note: The return must never be manually set to 'Organized'. If the return status is set to 'organized' manually, the return will not be recognized by our platforms, and it will never be forwarded to the return carrier. Please ensure the return status is 'Created' after you created the return.

Return Instructions

If the product is packed and sent by XPO:

  1. Create the Return in Magento

  2. Create a request using the XPO Contact form (see below)

  3. Receive label from XPO and forward to customer

  4. Insert tracking reference in the OMS

  5. Check return status on planned pickup date / after 1 week on XPO tracking page (How to check the pick-up status here: Carrier portals : Bettzeit GmbH (freshdesk.com))

  6. Ask the customer to contact Emma support again once the pick-up has been done. They will need to share a proof of return.

Once we receive the proof of return, mark the return as 'complete'. This will automatically trigger the refund process.

Where to find the contact form?

You can find it here

How to fill in the form?

1. Name of the agent

2. Order number of the client

3. Full name of the customer

4. Products to be picked- we do not need to include the SKU of the product, we just need to include the product name (Example: Emma Original, Almohada Premium, Canapé, etc)

5. Pick up address

6. City

7. Post Code

8. Province- it is the area in which the city or village is located. For example: Majadahonda is in Madrid

9.Phone number- phone number from the customer. In case it is a foreign phone, please always add the prefix (ex: for Portugal +351)

10. Observations- any important observations you might have

Note: We send the pick ups 3 times a week to XPO. Once they recorded in their system, you will be able to find it in Connect. To know how to use connect, please refer to this article.
